All the facilities you would expect from a far more expensive hotel were on hand, including satellite TV with several English channels. Exchange rate fluctuations meant that the final room price (charged in Turkish lira) was slightly more than the euro price originally quoted on Venere.com, but not by enough to warrant making a fuss. The drink and snack prices in the hotel's bar are extremely reasonable. But the strongest point of Angel's Home is undoubtedly the service, which cannot be faulted. All staff are very friendly, competent and excellent in every respect. I hope the owner realises how lucky he is to have them! In short, a three-star hotel with five-star service. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTY HOTEL Ä°N A GOLDENHORN”
Reviews.Author: tamararobert
Reviews.Content: we stay with my sister for birthday for my sister. my friend had stayed there before and recomended the angelshome. and later we did make reservation for angels suit room.. we had a really lovely 2 night. we like our room because on the room have a very big balcony , we taste hubble buble =) we did make breakfast on the our balcony firt day. You have very many alternative if you want make on the angels garden or on the big terrace . terrace wonderfull you can see all goldenhorn , all marmara see on the terrace realy. 5 minute inside you can go to blue mosque , sn sophia with by walk just 5 minute topkapi place nex to sn sophie museum .. on the angelshome person very smart realy and friendly . Ä± remember manager mr.Tekin.. we want came back new years . Ä± will make reservation same room (angels suit room thanks for good information , thank for relation ,thanks for all...

Reviews.Title: “Great room, friendly staff and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: imlidoll
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Istanbul and Angel's Home Hotel was a great place to start. We had a penthouse suite which proved hard to drag ourselves away from - a calm respite from the beautiful if busy city. Staff were helpful and friendly, breakfast a bit hit and miss but that seemed to apply to several Sultanahmet establishments! Free wifi an unexpected bonus. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: boltongirl12
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel, as the Tan Hotel could not accommodate our final night in Istanbul. We had definitely been spoiled at The Tan. Angel's Home was dingy, dark, the bathroom could have done with a good clean, it was cheap and tacky. The bedroom was just about OK, lovely view of the fire escape! The breakfast was average, not much choice, none of the lovely fruit we had had at the Tan. It was the same daily rate as the Tan and was very definitely of much inferior quality in every way. I certainly would not have eaten there in the evening, in fact we didn't see anyone eat there. The only saving grace is that the location is good, but there is much better value out there, would definitely not stay there again. Istanbul, however, is well worth visiting. Lots to see and do. The palace, Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, trip on the Bosphorous all highly recommended. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Angel Home - Karma always rights the wrongs”
Reviews.Author: kiwimam
Reviews.Content: Karma is an amazing thing - wait long enough & the universe right s the wrongs. Why say something now - basically its time. Initially really liked the Hotel, its position and friendly staff & helpful owner (older brother). THEN got ripped off by a staff member on a booked tour price and had equivalent to 800 UK in mixed currency stolen from our room safe which, other than us, only staff had access to. The owner had recommended a booked tour & made it clear that the management did not take a cut - the staff member who booked it however probably DID take a cut & we ended up paying 50% more than advised. He apologised & said it was his error but we still had to pay the extra cost. In rushing out on the tour we didnt notice that we had (foolishly for sure) left the safe key on a bedside table covered by a magazine & it was still covered when we got back. I had counted, written in my diary and bundled up the unrequired currency when we arrived & diidnt check it until the night before we were moving on. Cunningly the thief had removed money from each (type) currency bundle in the hope we wouldnt notice any was missing. I alerted the co-owner (younger brother) and initially he was helpful but later refused any responsibility and advised we couldnt prove anything & we should either basically `shut up' or go the police. We did go to the Police but received no help from management & the language barrier in the end meant no action was taken. During the extra day we had to stay on I got very distressed, more because my sister rang from NZ to advise my Mum was in hospital than the money loss (my Mum died soon after we got back home). The Duty Manager on that last day, had also made the tour MISTAKE & was also on at the time the money was taken. Reacting to my distress & trying to prove staff wouldnt take our money he ended up giving us information that basically only someone who had been in our room that day could know. 2 + 2 might make 4 but was still not proof. We had to choose wether the theft ruined our trip of a lifetimey & we deliberately chose not to let it - it wasnt our karma. The owner had said he would follow up on our complaint vigourously & contact us even if it was months/years later - STILL WAITING

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: mpowerMpower
Reviews.Content: We occupied angel suite room which was really comfortable. I was very surprised because of very high standard of this hotel taking into account low price and very good location close to most important sights of Istambul - Topkapi palace, Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar. It is also very good place to travel around Istanbul - tram and ferries are very close. Hotel offers one way airport transfer for free, also wireless internet access in rooms is free. Staff was really nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: hardBak_
Reviews.Content: very nice boutique hotel, we stayed for four days. room was very beautiful. hotel staff was very helpful to us. blue mosque, two minutes walk .thanks angelshome family.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent location, nice food”
Reviews.Author: MattandYar
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, close to main atractions and on a quiet street, room was clean and comfy, staff friendly and helpfull, huge breakfests. Two roof taraces with incredibile view....especially in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Just Weird”
Reviews.Author: SobieP
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Angel Home for 4 nights out of a 10 night trip to Turkey. First the positives. Staff were very friendly and happy to help, booking airport transfers and generally cheerful, and the hotel location is great for seeing Sultanahmet, although there are many many other hotels in the same area. There is a computer for free internet access in the lobby, although again this is a pretty common feature. Now on to the negatives. The room we had was large, but with strange decoration (it seems to be a 'love' theme, think of heart shaped cusions, canopy over the bed, red "satin" sheets, complimentary condom in bathroom (I'm not joking) - we didn't specifically ask for such a room). Air con was provided, but was old and had a musty smell about it when on, so we left it off. There were signs in the room stating that all outside food and drink was banned - and housekeeping would confiscate it from our rooms if found! Instead we were told to use the minibar (expensive) or room service (no prices advertised) We have stayed in many hotels worldwide but I have never seen such a policy anywhere. We took to sneaking water bottles past reception and hiding snacks in our luggage to avoid them getting taken. The bathroom was in need of redocoration, with paint peeling from the ceiling above the shower. Paint tended to fall on you whilst showering if you weren't careful. The shower itself initially didn't work but to their credit this was quickly fixed by hotel staff. The hotel is split over two sites a couple of minutes walk from each other. We had to walk to the other site for breakfast every morning. There was a lot of choice for breakfast, but unfortunately most of it was unappitising, consisting of plates of stone cold fried eggs, omlettes, potato wedges and crepes. One day we arrived at breakfast at 7:30am (the time breakfast starts) hoping for some hot crepes but no, they were still stone cold. We wondered when exactly they had been cooked. On the plus side the cakes are very good, there is hot scrambled eggs and french toast, and fresh watermelon is availiable. The coffee wasn't great, but there is a large selection of herbal teas. Unsurprisingly, we didn't try the dinner. We chose the hotel because of it's good TripAdvisor rating, and obviously a lot of people like it, but it wasn't really for us. We have stayed in other nearby hotels in Istanbul and found them to be significantly better for the price (e.g. Hotel Surmungen on the same street). Would give Angle's Home a rating 1.5 if it was possible.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location, amazing friendly and helpful staff- i doubt you'll get better value for money.”
Reviews.Author: JoMaginty
Reviews.Content: Excellent location on gorgeous quiet street but still right next to all of the atmosphere of 'old' istanbul. The staff couldn't have been nicer, more welcoming and unobtrusive. The beds were extremely comfortable and they had gone out of thier way to attend to all the little details, (bath robes, ribbons around the towels) all the things you would expect in a much more expensive hotel. The bathroom was dated and patterned but clean and serving the purpose. Amazing views over the Bosphorous. I think this hotel was underpriced and you wouldn't be able to get better for the same price or even quite a bit more.., however there are lots of nice hotels along the same street and if you want a bit more created atmosphere and to meet people this wouldn't be were it is 'happening' Breakfast was varied and again with a choice you wouldnt expect in such a small hotel. the 'Angel's Home' table wine was gorgeous and cheap. My recomendation would be to stay here and to go to the blue hotel at the top of the hill (expensive) and have dinner at their roof top resturant which has the best views over the old city.. we went up lotsof roofs on our trip. Angel's Home has a nice roof with good view but it isn't the best. I can't recomend it higher and i love Istanbul- it's my new favourite place.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was fine, but there's much better value around..”
Reviews.Author: Andysurf
Reviews.Content: The Angel's Home is welcoming , clean & well-located. Our rooms were very comfortable & well-equipped, if slightly small with a tiny balcony. Roof-top terrace has stunning views but unfortunately we had to go round the corner to the hotel's other site for breakfast. The breakfast was good, but served in slightly scruffy surroundings. As we stayed 3 nights we were given a free transfer from the airport which was very welcome. The hotel is pleasantly located in a quiet side street within easy walking distance of the Blue Mosque & Agia Sofia. The manager wouldn't let us reserve a room for just 1 night for our return to Istanbul before the flight home & this was a good thing as during our travels in Turkey we realised that much better value was available in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Pushy and aggressive management!!!”
Reviews.Author: jokusz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in .From the moment we walked in the manager started in about buying carpets .He was quite relentless even with a very blunt no! He would just say why we can come to a deal lets bargain lets bargain! Then he had the gall to say it was we who had approached him about his carpet store. The next issue was his tour buisiness he does tours of various kinds.We did book an allday tour with him but the weather stopped it about an hour into the tour, raining! It was to include lunch as well which we did not get !He refused any refund of money at all around $150. The hotel itself was small and dingy and very bad food for breakfast and dinner as we ate our first meal there.At night is was very noisy party downstairs in the dinning area every night. Bad Bad Bad!!! We have travelled world wide and this was one of our expieriance's!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and staff, good location, low prices”
Reviews.Author: Pennylane81
Reviews.Content: Having booked our rooms in Angel's home by internet, we were more than delighted to find out that everything that was worth seeing in the center of Istanbul was in a walking distance from the hotel, which is situated near Hagia Sofia. It is a very cosy and cute hotel, the rooms were very comfortable and clean. Moreover the staff was very polite, spoke very good english, were friendly and made every effort to help us whenever we were in need of sthg. For breakfast there was a big variety of dishes and there is free access to the internet. Would definitely recommend it and go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jamesst75
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is in a great location (2 blocks from the Blue Mosque) and has an excellent young staff - very pleasant and attentive. The rooms are small but that is expected in a European style hotel (shower may be a little difficult for some to get in and out of) . Morning breakfast is a full selection of hot and cold dishes. Area around hotel has many small shops, restaurants, and bars, and is very lively. Staff speaks passable English and makes every effort to accommodate guests. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Stepmad09
Reviews.Content: A very freindly, reasobably prices hotel with a good breakfast and very cute and helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Poor Hotel - Even Worse Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Tess22
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel Angel's Home (www.hotelangelshome.com) having booked over the internet. Initially the staff were friendly and helpful on arrival. The hotel itself is in a shabby condition. We made our way to the "Penthouse Suite" which was on the top floor. The room smelled heavily of floral perfume and was decorated in a bizarre dated / motel fashion. The balcony was smaller than had been advertised as was the room having very low ceilings. The bathroom was dingy and the whole room was particularly depressing. We went to Angel's Home's second site to check the alternative rooms and found them equally uninspiring for the price. We told the staff that we did not want to stay in the hotel and asked what we could do about a refund. We were told that as we had booked over the internet and paid up front, both of which were requirements of booking, we had no rights and therefore had to forfeit all our money, which was four nights totalling 438,6 Euro. We stated that we were happy to discuss a compromise recognising that we would probably lose the first nights money however the management expressed quite a hostile attitude telling us that becuase he deals over the internet he would not be able to resell the room. He told us that there was no way that we would be able to get any money back, despite an ongoing email dialogue with him. Having discussed the matter with the local tourism bureau we were advised that there are many complaints from people who booked over the internet only to find their accommodation poor and customer service to match. We wanted to post this to make sure that people did not make the same mistake that we did. After hours of walking in the sun we found the Hotel Ibrahim Pasha in the same area, which is roughly the same price but a world apart.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Schammster
Reviews.Content: At first I was concerned - my Expedia packaged holiday seemed way to cheap for this hotel to be any good. My mind was somewhat laid at ease once I started corresponding with the hotel regarding their transfer service. Their prompt replies paved the path to the good service we received in the hotel. The best part about Angel's Home is undoubtedly its location. Away from the hubbub of Sultanahmet, the part of the hotel we stayed in is situated at the end of neon-lit yet quiet road, around the corner of good restaurants (Sofa Restaurant), quaint shops and wonderful rooftop terraces, including the hotel's own, where one can admire one of the most impressive views of the Blue Mosque (especially at night) on one side and the Bosphorous on the other. Despite it's relatively remote and quiet location compared to other hotels and hostels in the vicinity, most sights are well within walking distance (Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Hippodrome, Basilica Cistern) and those that aren't are easily accessed via the Sultanahmet tram station, which again is no more than a 10 minute walk from the hotel. In addition to the hotel's location, the rooms were clean, and featured everything a weary traveller might desire - from a shower lined with small jets that gently massage your back, to deodorant, disposable toothbrushes and razors, and even condoms! Although I highly recommend Angel's home I was disappointed with their breakfast buffet and would advise anyone travelling from Ataturk Airport to Sultanahmet to either use public transport (clean, reliable, cheap) or a taxi (shouldn't cost more than 20 lira) and not to make use of the hotel's overpriced transfer service at 25 euros.

Reviews.Title: “It was more than what we expected.”
Reviews.Author: tiberiu_oprea
Reviews.Content: It was more than what we expected. A very good price and quality. High place from all attractions , sightseeing and public transport.The staff is amazing.Breakfast was a happy combination of traditional and clasic.Details are those that make a difference in favor of the hotel which we recommend all true tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Great location Great staffs more than making up for small room”
Reviews.Author: Paul_CM
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights at this hotel. I and my colleague stayed in the Deluxe Double while my boss and his wife stayed in the Sultanahmet Suite. The room is a bit small even for the suite. Another draw back from was the maid failed to stock toiletiers in our room. Lucky that we packed our stuffs from home. Location is great as it locates in the old city section just below Blue Mosque. Staffs were very friendly and the owner and his sons always available at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A charming and friendly place, which made our trip and that we look forward to staying in again...”
Reviews.Author: AdamMups
Reviews.Content: I will hardly be able to do justice to everything we liked about Angel's Home Hotel during our 4 day stay there in June 2009. The hotel was attractive and comfortable; it had everything we could have wanted during our stay, whilst maintaining the charm and character of a small family run hotel. Location was ideal - tucked away quietly in the Old Town, but conveniently close to transport links (eg the tram) and the sights. The views over the old town from the roof terrace were gorgeous, and we very much enjoyed relaxing up there, whether for an evening drink or the late breakfasts that the staff would bring up for us from the hotel restaurant. The two brothers who own and run the hotel deserve a special mention and a lot of thanks, having gone out of their way to be friendly and helpful both before and throughout our stay, arranging transfer from the airport, providing advice about our planned trips, and even researching and booking a fantastic restaurant for us! In such a fantastic and beautiful city, the fact that the hotel features highly in our fondest memories of Istanbul should speak volumes about the place. We would definitely stay at the Angel's Home Hotel again, and have no hesitation in recommending it to all!

Reviews.Title: “helpful staff, great location....all round great!”
Reviews.Author: bosphouros
Reviews.Content: Great helpful staff, they were very friendly. Held our bags at no extra cost, let us check out late at no extra cost. Called cabs to make sure we were not ripped off. Recommended restaurants with our specifications on what we wanted. Room was very clean, sheets and towles were very clean. Room was tidy everytime we came back. Unlimited use of internet. Breakfast was included 8 -10 am. the only comment was that i would prefer to see less cats in the dinning courtyard where the food is. in saying that it was all still clean and hygenic. Note that there is two different locations of the hotel (one the standard and one delux 2mins walking distance from each other) the one in all the photos is the deluxe. Great loction...all in all very happy with our stay. Enjoy your dona kababs and roof top bars!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but there are better in the area”
Reviews.Author: Mimicri
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK, but other places in the same street have far better value for the same prices. Rooms are a bit dark and sheets could be cleaner, the furniture and sheets are all held in dark red, the lobby smells a bit like cats, the courtyard outside the breakfast room could be tidied sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, view, staff”
Reviews.Author: UAEresident
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend the penthouse rooms. They are quiet and look out over the Bosphorus or the Sultanahmet Mosque. Also recommend the restaurant. Staff excellent and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice building and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Gershiuz
Reviews.Content: Reservation made from booking.com is cheaper than hotelÂ´s web page. Once we arrived it was full, therefore we got a suite 5 nights same price as a standard one...The location is incredible, quiet and not noisy, though at 4am youÂ´ll heard the call for praying, but it will happens everywhere because of the mosqueÂ´s speakers. Young staff and very helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, friendly and situated in a very nice place”
Reviews.Author: mariaPiraeus
Reviews.Content: We visited first time this hotel. Our impression was very good. People were very friendly, room were nice and romantic style decorated, clean and the neighbourhood very calm. I think that it is a nice place for couples.

Reviews.Title: “An hotel with outstanding staff in an outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: Senod
Reviews.Content: We were heartened by the warm reception we received upon entering the hotel. They had met us at the airport following a long flight from Canada. We were immediately offered refreshments and we stayed and chatted with (I am not sure of the spelling) Shaquil until out room was ready. Shaquil was very obliging and arranged visits to a Turkish Bath, a "Whirling Dervish" performance and transportation to a restaurant. The location was within walking distance to most major attractions in the city and was surrounded with local restaurants priced very reasonably. We tried Turkish wine for the first time at one of these restaurants and found it to be excellent! Our room was very attractive, looking like a harem chamber decorated in reds and hearts. A little kitschy but clean and pleasant with its shrouded four poster bed. The rooftop terrace was closed but still provided excellent views of the Blue Mosque and surrounding area. An ample breakfast was served at their other location nearby. All in all an excellent experience and greatly enhanced by the helpful, cheery staff, particularly Shaquil.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel for anyone wanting great location and helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: leep21
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and tidy,the staff are helpfull,friendly and polite, and couldnt do enough for me. i have stayed at the hotel a few time and will be going back to stay very soon,as the location it is in is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place To Unwind and Enjoy During Your Visit To Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: venusluxury
Reviews.Content: I've been visiting istanbul for past few years .and I had stay in Angels Home Hotel more then 6th times , I can not write as much as I want about the queality and service you gonna get in that Hotel, which you better say it is not the hotel that would be your house in istanbul, friendly and responsible staff , great food ,Excellent service great location which you gonna save you a lot of money to go to visit the historical places of istanbul because they all around that hotel within 2 minutes walking distance . and lets say about how clean the rooms are the owner and the staff dont look at you as a customer and tourist they are looking at you as a friend and family that they want to do their best to make you feel like you are in your home and just enjoy of your vacation in istanbul . the breakfast that you gonna have in there is one of the best made all with fresh stuff with the best quality if you wanna try some good turkish cuisine ,I highly recommend you to try angelshome Restaurant . the view of the marmara sea and historical sultanahmed that you can see from your window or from the balcony is priceless . and at the end there is only one big problem is with Angelshome hotel which is if you stay there once you will not gonna enjoy of any other hotels in istanbul because none of them has that service and quality which angelshome gonna provide you so just make sure to book your room in angelshome hotel before you fly to istanbul .

Reviews.Title: “Original Turkish hospitality”
Reviews.Author: lenakiAthens
Reviews.Content: when Instanbul decided for our winter holidays this year I have to admit that we were afraid of what is going to happened there in acommodation conditions. Though the specific hotel provided us the best acoomodation ever. In and out the hotel everything were harmonic and tidied up! Te rooms provided the best accomodation and the personell get throug its best! The location was also excellent, very close to the sights and the real Turkey the same time.. I was very pleased really...

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: MumbaiTraveller1
Reviews.Content: Very nice quaint hotel, breakfast was not very fresh, but staff was extremely helpful and consistent

Reviews.Title: “warm and cozy”
Reviews.Author: Stella065
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the moment we said goodbye, the warm and friendly staff at Angel's Hotel made us feel welcome and comfortable. We really liked the fact that it was very close to the most important sightseeings of the city, the stylish and comfortable rooms and also the very good food and service. We left beautiful Istanbul with the best impressions and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: 8sagittarius
Reviews.Content: I visited Istanbul with friends and booked this hotel through internet.We did nt know what to expect, fortunately we came along with a nice and cosy hotel with clean rooms and all the facilities. Very nice breakfast and above all friendly and gentle staff. If i visited Istanbul again i would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: TravelLuvr1979
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful. Our room was even nicer than expected, we had a huge room with a king sized bed with a canopy, slippers, and bathrobes! The location was excellent. It is within very short walking distance to many places, in a very safe neighborhood. The staff was very helpful and kind as well. We loved our stay here and I would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: KseniyaMinsk
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the staying. The hotel had all the charm I was looking for in Istanbul. It was just about everything you could ask for: pleasant atmosphere, amazing view restaurant, cozy and pleasantly furnished rooms, really personalized and caring service and attention, very friendly and helpful with any my question stuff, excellent value in a convenient location.This hotel 100% will be my choice when I visit Istanbul the next time. All the best regards to the stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Best Turkish experience, ever!”
Reviews.Author: nimrodel82
Reviews.Content: For my job, I visit Istanbul quite frequently, but decided to spend my 5 days break in Istanbul just to enjoy this beautiful city. With my fiance we definitely enjoyed our stay in the hotel. The staff was very friendly, rooms were clean and the hotel was at a great location, close to main tourist attractions and transportation facilities to nightlife. Would definitely like to repeat this experience!

Reviews.Title: “excelent hotel”
Reviews.Author: alexlee_9
Reviews.Content: we stayed one week with my wife for our wedding anniversary.we had deluxe room and we absolutely loved it, friendly staff,safe and good location.very close to hagia sophia,blue mosgue,grand bazaar.........i recomend everyone..

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and service, right next to the Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: taydiver127
Reviews.Content: Although you wouldn't notice it if you passed by it, this quaint hotel right down the street from the Blue Mosque is perfect for the traveler trying to get away, while still being in the middle of everything. The service is excellent, with a very personable wait and bell staff. The hotel offers dinners cafe style on the walkway next to the converted hotel and rooftop breakfasts overlooking the Bosporus and Blue Mosque. Great deal for a single room and full board. As a young traveler, there is also the main drag of private hostels and hookah lounges a couple streets over. Overall, I was made very welcome and felt like I had an insiders look into Istanbul. Amazing stay!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place!”
Reviews.Author: valentina18
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay there! The hotel has a really good location, very good situated, which gives handy get to any necessary places. Rooms are very comfortable, clean and light, lovely furnished, and the bed was great (matress, duvet and pillows). Nice and peaceful atmosphere, efficient and friendly staff. I hope you guys keep up the good work! We had such a good time! Great people and great price! Really enjoyable. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was marvelous!!!”
Reviews.Author: jazvochka
Reviews.Content: Actually it wasn't my first visit to Istanbul but that time when I stayed at Angel's Home Hotel was the most unforgetable! What did my trip so memorable? First of all my friends around and of course that beautiful hotel I had pleasure to stay. Comfortable, clean rooms, polite staff, everything was wonderful and impressed me a lot. But there is one thing i just must mention about: it's the best combination "price-location". Due to perfect location of Angel's Home Hotel I could reach almost all sights on foot without any problem. So I enjoyed walking in the streets of Old City and could avoid traffic jams:) As for prices of the hotel they were very attractive! And one more time I want to mention staff of Angel's Home Hotel. Because they could create such amicable atmosphere and made my staying there so comfortable!!! Hope it wasn't my last time I shared the hospitality of this hotel:)

Reviews.Title: “warm and cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: caledoniabunny
Reviews.Content: the hotel is not big, not pretty warm and cozy atmosphere, feel very close and intimate. it's decoration is pretty artistic and can feel the culture of turkey in the hotel for the frist impression of this country for a foreigner. the location is ideal for sightseeing, very convenient, just right clost the the blue moque etc.., hotel itself is very quite, but properous life reveal with 2 miniutes away from the hotel, the center of city is in front of you. Food is very tasty in the sea view restaurant in garden as well. rooms are kept very clean etc... i will say cozy holiday there.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday in Angel's Home Hotel”
Reviews.Author: siyahAntalya
Reviews.Content: We spent an exellent holiday in Angel's Home Hotel. I advise to everyone who wants to spend a comfortable, enjoyable and restful holiday. And hotel has very friendly and helpful stuff also very clean rooms. Enjoy yourself:))

Reviews.Title: “We had a nice time at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Slv-travel
Reviews.Content: I have spent a nice time at Angel's Home Hotel. Good service for 3 * hotel, at a good price. The personnel was nice and place was clean in good location.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, very friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Basturk7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week with my family...we had a wonderful time there, the staff were terrific, always very helpful and made us feel extremely welcome. The atmosphere was fantastic and I will definately be going back to stay there. I can confidently recommend Angels Home to everybody visiting Istanbul...you will NOT be disappointed. :)

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED our stay!!”
Reviews.Author: TokenLP
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days and had an incredible time. The staff is great especially Ufuk, who took me on a journey into the heart of Istanbul to find me an authentic Hookah! They were always willing to have Tea with you and the location is just amazing! A little far away from the nightlife but close to EVERYTHING else. Just a tip, be very weary about any stranger coming to talk to you...odds are they are trying to sell you a rug. In that case tell them you already bought one and they will leave you alone. I would really recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: melkozek
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week at the Angel's Home Hotel and found it to be the frielndliest hotel we have ever stayed at in Europe. The location was great and we appreciated it even more when we visited other parts of the city. It was peaceful and quiet in the Sultanahmet district and the hotel itself was very quiet. (Except for the call to prayer from the Blue Mosque). We tend to like small hotels when we travel and it looked like there were only 12-14 rooms at the Angel's Home, although there was another building around the corner where there were standard rooms and where breakfast was served. The rooms were large by European standards and the bathroom was quite nice. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and gracious, like so many people in Istanbul. We would go back without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great place a stones throw from the Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: swede1102
Reviews.Content: Angel's Home is a great hotel in two(!) separate locations close to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. Breakfast was great as was the service in the restaurant at night. Our room was cozy and met all our needs. The major reason why you would want to stay here is the location, however. Afternoon naps come to an end when the guy in the minaret goes to work at 6pm, as the Blue Mosque is only a three minuet walk away. Hagia Sophia not much farther. The proximity to the tramway makes this easily accessible from the airport by use of subway and tramway. The tramway takes you down to the harbor for trips to Asia, a walk over to Galata or a visit to Suleimanyie Mosque. The Grand Bazaar is also fairly close to the hotel. If you are just spending a few days in Istanbul, you don't want to waste precious time on unnecessary transportation. Hence, Angel's Home is a great place for a long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Ulalume
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days, early January in one of the suites. I couldnt agree more with most of the other reviews! The hotel is in perfect location for the historic sites, and just minutes from the tramline. The staff is very helpful, the room was perfectly clean, equipped and with amazing views of the Asian Shore. The breakfast might not be exceptional but this was the least of things in your mind while waking up and falling asleep with a view like this! We had a perfect holiday, and the hotel stay was definetely one of the a reasons why. +

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit to Angel's Home”
Reviews.Author: Westrest
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Angel's Home, but this time we stayed at the main hotel (the one with the dining room), rather than the other one round the corner. All booking arrangments, including bank transfer of charges in order to qualify for discount, went smoothly, and our driver was waiting on arrival at the airport. Our room was clean and well-equipped, and very well maintained throughout our stay. All members of staff were friendly and courteous, and many remembered us from our visit two years previously. The excellent buffet breakfast set us up for the rest of the day and the hotel is exceptionally well positioned for seeing all the sights of Sultanahmet. We would have no hesitation in recommending Angel's Home and, indeed, friends have already stayed their on our recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, cozy, quiet”
Reviews.Author: kooop
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week-long stay in Istanbul at the Angel's Home Hotel.... The staff were very friendly and helpful and unobtrusive. The room was very clean and would always be made up on our return with fresh towels and clean linens. We had an incredible view of the Bosphorus from the top floor, and got a good workout in every day from the stairs! My only complaint is the breakfast, just because it seemed like some of the food was a little stale or strange, but I'm notoriously picky. And as someone else mentioned, beware the morning muezzin wakeup call! .... we heard it the night before and figured out what was going on, however, if we only heard it that morning it would have definitely been a shock. Now I miss it!

Reviews.Title: “great find!”
Reviews.Author: clairekus
Reviews.Content: Ive just returned from 4 nights at Angels home. Its a great little guest house, the hotel is split into 2 hotels (1 & 2 .. only a few mins away from each other) we stayed in angels home 2, which also has a restaurant on the ground floor. the rooms were very clean, a little bit small, but big enough for what we needed it for, we had 2 rooms, a twin & a double. the bathroom is well stocked with bits & pieces you may have forgotten to bring, even a toothbrush & paste, razor & deodorant. The location is fantastic & when i visit again, i will try to stay in the same area, there are so many really good places to eat within a block of the hotel, the area feels really safe, we travelled as 3 women & not once did we feel threatened in Istanbul, but especially in the area surrounding the hotel, all the people were very friendly & the local shop & restaurant workers soon got to know your face & didnt hastle to much as you walked by. a few restaurants that are a must & just around the corner are Oceans 7 & Antique turqoise .. both had fantastics meals & we ate at both of them twice (Lunch & dinner) be aware that as the hotel is so close to the blue mosque, the call to prayer is very loud, our first night there we slept with the window open & almost jumped out of our skin at 6am when the call started. The breakfast buffet was OK, we would have prefered more of a choice of fruits (only available was oranges & grapefruit) but what was on offer was nice & plentiful. The only downside was that we found the hotel to be very smoky, not sure if it was hotel guests smoking in the rooms or if the smoke was coming from the restuarant, but during the nights we often woke to the smell of smoke wafting under our doors. the restaurant was the same, we would have liked to have eaten there as the food did look very good, but there was always a group of people smoking heavily & as its quiet a small room it would be very uncomfortable eating in there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mbelki
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel on line...the staff was very easy to deal with through email to determine the right room and pricing. They booked me a great room with a sea view and arranged for a car to pick me up from the airport. Upon arrival to the hotel, the staff was extra friendly and helpful in finding my way around. Every time I would return to the hotel, they were warm and friendly. The hotel is in a great location, just a block and a half from the Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia. All the major historic sites are within walking distance. My room was comfortable, on the top floor of the hotel. There is not an elevator, so be prepared to walk up. The hotel has wireless service and a terminal too, complimentary. Breakfast was also included, and is a well stocked buffet. Price wise, it was inexpensive, so for the cost, very good value. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weeken in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Reiseglad43
Reviews.Content: Grandparents with two (twins) girls at 8 experienced Istanbul from the most picturesque side, staying in the middle of Istanbul's old town. The Blue Mosque was so close that we could "thouch it" in these wonderful November nights, sitting on the roof terrace. All objects you want to see in Istanbul were within walking distances from the hotel, and after the first day the carpet sellers recognized us and just said good morning or hello when we passed. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful, everything was arranged the way we wanted it. The building itself was not very modern or up to date, but we found it quite in order. Nice weather and "out of season"-time of the year was perhaps two other reasons that this trip turned out so well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: berurier
Reviews.Content: Staff : very friendly and helpfull, except a young woman who seems unable to say "hello" in the breakfast room.. Location : perfect....50 meters to the Arasta Bazaar. Rooms : our room (the penthouse) was large, nice (a little bit kitsch...) , clean. Bathroom was also large and clean with a bubble-bath. And much of all : it was SILENT...You hear nothing at night. It's so nice to sleep well after a long day walking. Breakfast : good (filtered coffee is not good just like everywhere in Turkey). Big choice of fruits, vegetables, cheese and some hot dishes like eggs, omelettes, sausages... Service : very good. There was a problem with light in the barhroom. I told it to the reception, and it was quickly done. There was also a problem with hotel/airport transfert service. Looks like the company they use forgot us. They brought us at the airport with a car of the hotel and the son of the boss to drive us.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Angel's Home-A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: world_travelers_D&L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Angel's Home the first week of September 2008. If you are looking for a "sleek" 5 star impersonal hotel with elevators, this is not the hotel for you. Angel's is in the historic Sulanahmet district so what you do get is great charm and character. We stayed in the Angel's suite, which was very well appointed. The only minor issue, better lighting for applying makeup, could have been provided. The staff went way beyond "doing their job." They would inquire often if we wanted or needed anything. Tekin and Murat, who managed the front desk, were always available to answer questions and make helpful suggestions. I detest breakfast but after seeing the variety of very well prepared food, I completely changed my mind. The dinners, which are served in the other building, were just as good. Once again, the staff at both buildings were exceptional. We have traveled the world and have never stayed at a hotel that had such a friendly and helpful staff. If youâ€™re going to Istanbul and want to stay in the historic district we highly recommend Hotel Angelâ€™s Home. We definitely will be staying there on our next trip there. Angelâ€™s did offer us an upgrade to the penthouse suite, which was a generous offer, but it was in the other building and we would have missed the staff. This place has it all!

Reviews.Title: “The best choice in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: dolce1978
Reviews.Content: Wow! All I can say is that I'm so glad I booked this hotel for our recent trip to Istanbul. My mum and I spent 5 nights at the Angel's Home Hotel for our first visit to this fantastic city. We chose to stay in Sultanahmet as we were mostly interested in the history and sights of the old town rather than the modern busy city of new Istanbul. And we couldn't have made a better choice. Firstly, having travelled all over the world and being a massive fan of tripadvisor - I'm surprised that this hotel isn't further up the ranks. When we booked we were torn between two choices, the Angles Home Hotel and one of the others which was rated in the top 5. We chose Angles Home hotel (ranked at 38) as it was cheaper, seemed to have more genuine reviews and the hotel website was more inviting. Having seen the other hotel we are so glad we chose the Angles Home as whilst it seemed nice too, the Angels home is so much more personal and the service and staff were absolutely unbeatable. I honestly can't think of a hotel were I have felt more welcome, and looked after. We chose the penthouse room as it had a large balcony with sea views (highly recommended) and expedia had a great deal on which made it cheaper than the deluxe rooms (no balcony). The views were fantastic and the rooms were very charming with lots of little extras like robes, slippers and toiletries - not what you'd expect from a 3* hotel/B&B. If you like ultra modern and minimalist - this hotel isn't for you, but then you'd be better off in one of the skyscrapers in modern Istanbul if that's the case. The Angles Home is extremely well thought out, traditional in terms of decor and only down side is that as it's an original old building they can't have lifts - so the penthouse was a few floors up a beautiful winding staircase. But if you can handle a bit of exercise - it's definitely worth it for the views and huge balcony. We had room 302-E, and from what I saw of the others this was by far the best. The breakfast is also fantastic. Huge variety of Turkish and continental breakfast, with some hot food too. This was served from the roof top of the sister hotel (also the Angels home) around the corner. And as for location, I don't believe you can get better. It is literally 100 metres from the blue mosque, surrounded by street cafes and restaurants but just out of the hustle and bustle enough so that it was really peaceful. Overall I think this is one of the nicest and best value hotels Iâ€™ve ever stayed in, and would recommend it to everyone I know!

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: uschCanada
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 lovely nights at Angels Home Htotel on our recent visit to Turkey. We had a nice clean room which I believe was the deluxe double, although I had booked the standard..bonus! The breakfast in the morning was great, served on the rooftop terrace which offers a great view of the city and harbour. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the hotel is well located in the Sultanhamet area. Based on our experience, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: SigiL
Reviews.Content: If you want a romantic we, just go there! We went there to celebrate our anniversary and where not disappointed! Lovely place, huge beds! We did not take the standard room but the superior (I don't remember how they call them) and it was really nice. Highly recommended, very good location & quiet, except from the 5AM pray that you will hear in the whole city, not only here. Noise sensitive : take earplugs cause it is really annoying... I knew it upfront and thought that it would be "exotic", well, it is not, and it lasts for ages... But as said, nothing to do with the hotel, which I could not recommend enough. Our room was the perfect place to relax & warm up after a long day outside in the cold winter.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LPCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 6 days. It is a very cosy hotel, and it is very nicely situated - about 100 metres from the Blue Mosque. Some of the installations in the bathroom looked a little home-made. The staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: shonesScotland
Reviews.Content: angel's home hotel offers excellent service, charming staff, clean rooms and possibly the best location in istanbul for exploring the old city. we were only 5 minutes walk from the blue mosque, topkapi palace and the haghia sophia. the hotel is also surrounded by restaurants which are quite cheap compared to those on the main drag by the basilica cistern/tramline. the imam biyaldi-aubergines filled with veg- can be bought at sofa cafe across from angel's home hotel and it is delicious! all the staff at the hotel could not have been more helpful or cheerful.shakeel organised a trip to the sulemaniye bathhouse for us and also found times for the ferry to princes islands.they were genuinely concerned that we were making the most of our stay and that everything was to our satisfaction. breakfast was the best experience as it was served on the roof top with commanding views of the bosphorous and the blue mosque. fab photo opportunity and the food was varied as well-try the apple tea and the dolmades. our rooms were kept immaculate and turkish delight was left in our room each day. we had a family room with air con and it was spacious and clean. we loved our stay at angel's home and would definitely recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cateflea
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here over 5 nights. Super location in the Sultanahmet district, walking distance to practically everything. Rooms were clean and comfortable, with lots of thoughtful touches in them. Staff were without exception friendly and helpful. Thanks in particular to the guys in the hotel who brought the European cup to life. As sad British non-participants, it was great to watch Turkey in action and we have now adopted them as 'our' team! Turkey have just scored against Germany as I'm writing this!!!!! Istanbul is a fabulous city, very beautiful and atmospheric. Every touristic venue worth visiting and also don't miss Basilica Cistern. Also have supper on the roof top of Seven Hills Hotel - lovely food and spectacular views of the Blue Mosque and Agia Sofia (and if you're lucky and free view of the 'Son et Lumiere' show where the Mosque gets all lit up). Just watch the taxi drivers - the yellow cabs give you the feeling that there is a code of conduct, but unless you are absolutely sure of where you are going and how to get there, you could well end up getting fleeced. Terrific value for money.

Reviews.Title: “If I were an angel, I would stay here”
Reviews.Author: DrBellowz
Reviews.Content: Angel's Home is a great home base for an Istanbul adventure. Located in the Sultanahmet, you are a stones throw from the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. The tram is also very close which takes you to all the interesting parts of the city. My room was great with comfortable beds, television and a fridge. There was lokum (turkish delight) left for us by the housekeeping staff which is a nice touch. The bathroom was good size and the shower was hot. There is a terrace on the roof where breakfast is served. From there you have a great view of the Blue Mosque. The staff are very friendly and there was not a single problem with the hotel. Well, the internet was slow but luckily there is another location a block away with a faster connection. The hotel offers free breakfast every day and a single free welcome dinner in their restaurant. Both were very good. i was slightly annoyed that some things are charged in euro (airport transport) and others in lira (food) but thats a minor issue. Angel's Home is definitely the place to stay when you're in the Ottoman Empire.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: JohnRiley
Reviews.Content: I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. The staff were universally friendly and helpful, the rooms were very nice and the view from the terrace simply stunning. All our requests - from wanting the room to be warmer to requesting a late check-out - were dealt with professionally and quickly. This was my third visit to Istanbul and was certainly the best hotel i stayed. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Too Expensive for What They Offer!!!”
Reviews.Author: SpeedyGonzales27
Reviews.Content: I reserved this hotel due to the good reviews on TripAdvisor and nice deal on another website. But when we arrived at the hotel we were disappointed. Decoration of the room was fine just the way it is represented on the websites, but in reality everything was like fake/artificial. They tried to give the impression about romance, and they barely made it, not entirely.. Anyway, I travel more than 30.000 miles every year and this was the worst price/value ratio I've ever seen, in conclusion this hotel is very expensive for what they're offering.. Inside decoration is fine and rooms are in good condition, but there are way better deals and more romantic hotels around..

Reviews.Title: “Kennedy,s of Kent”
Reviews.Author: Terjen
Reviews.Content: No complaints. Exceptional value.Location perfect.Staff attentive and very helpful.More so than higher rated establishments.Also at a price the retired can afford!!! It being our first visit to Istanbul we booked with a certain trepidation but discovered an ideal breakaway holiday and hotel. Even the carpet sellers are amusing and great value!!!

Reviews.Title: “Be careful!”
Reviews.Author: Caoimhin
Reviews.Content: Great location for visiting Sultanamet, with friendly staff and some charm, but it has many significant problems. 1) Fleas in the bedroom, providing sleepless nights. 2) Breakfast was in a different building in a restaurant on a street around the corner. 3) There was no room service, the food very poor (experimentation was required). The hotel could do with a general spruce and/or renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Planning on coming back to Angel's Home”
Reviews.Author: Alicia_Australia
Reviews.Content: Reviewer: Alicia, Australia As two 26 year old first time travellers to Turkey, my partner and I did not know what to expect coming to Istanbul. We had originally booked only 2 nights at Angel's Home prior to departing Australia, thinking we would likely want to explore elsewhere during our eight nights in Istanbul. However, after staying one night we immediately decided to extend our stay by an additional six nights at Angel's Home. Apart from the fantastic location, the staff and the quality of our room were the deciding factors. We stayed in an incredible double deluxe room, and the staff were fantastic. From advising on tours, things to do and even where and how to get a great birthday cake, it was the staff that really made our stay at the Angel's Home so memorable. After leaving Istanbul only seven days ago, we are already planning our next trip back and will definately stay at the Angel's Home again.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Time in Angel's Suite”
Reviews.Author: kurtvart
Reviews.Content: From the moment our cruise ship docked in Istanbul and we were picked up promptly in a nice van, courtesy of Angel's Home, our honeymoon residence was wonderful! The hotel was clean and comfortable and in a super location. We had a wonderful Bosphorus view from our private balcony of the Angel's Suite. Your are in the heart of historic Istanbul here. And Topkapi, the Blue Mosque, Ayasofya, the Grand Bazaar, Hippodrome, the Basilica Cistern, Archaeological Museum and many more are all within walking distance. Great restaurants abound -- including that of Angel's Home (especially breakfast). The waitstaff at dinner were attentive, prompt, and, like most of the people we met in Istanbul, had a great sense of humor. The desk clerk was efficient and nice as were all staff members. Hakan was kind enough to personally set up a private guided tour from Pierre Loti hill in Eyup all the way to a fantastic restaurant on the Asian side. His hospitality helped make our stay great. Room amenities were nice. We very much appreciated the fact that the curtains in the room were very heavy, making it dark enough in the room to get a good night's sleep. We would recommend Angel's Home to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Check before you pay”
Reviews.Author: continent
Reviews.Content: We certainly recommend this hotel if you are visiting Istanbul for sightseeing purpose. It is a cute and clean hotel and has all room amenities; probably more than we expected! If , however, you happen to drink any thing from room minibar make sure you check that you are paying for the right product as they don't seem to keep a good record of what the customers consume. We drank two small bottles of water and they charged us for two big bottles! We were a fool for not checking before we paid as we trusted their calculations and maybe it's an intential way of overcharging the customers. So just check before you pay so they can accept their mistake while you are at the counter rather than when you have left the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tracy070
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel in the Sultanahmet district. Very friendly staff. If you want a view of the sea I suggest you pay the extra for a penthouse room. I booked directly with the hotel over the internet, which included free transport from the airport (min. 3 nights stay), buffet breakfast and a set 3 course dinner, which was great value. Would definitely stay there again. Tracy - Brisbane, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Angel's Home is Heavenly!”
Reviews.Author: LunaSombra
Reviews.Content: Angel's Home was a gift from a pasha to his adored wife, Angel. The location is perfect, a five minute walk to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, the Cistern, Haga Sofia, and many fantastic restaurants. Although this charming hotel is located in the center of Istanbul's must-see sites, it's a few doors off the main street - perfectly situated for maximum access and minimum street noise. The rooftop terrace hovers between the Blue Mosque and the sea, giving the impression of floating on a magic carpet. The staff is very attentive without being intrusive. The property is safe, well-maintained, very clean, and the rooms are extremely comfortable. If you want a sleek, glitzy hotel, Angel's Home is not for you. If, however, you want to feel like an old friend returning to the comforts of home and the warmth of friends, you'll love Angel'sHome. Peggy & Michelle

Reviews.Title: “It's the People !”
Reviews.Author: clouwho
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Angel's Home in the first part of October for eight days. This is a family run hotel ( two brothers) and it is clear that the brothers and their staff understand the essentials of running a great small hotel. The hotel itself is well located in Sultan Ahmet and is well maintained. Our room was a deluxe double with a balcony. The room was sufficiently large and appointed and the balcony, while just overlooking a backyard was nice to have. The difference at Angel's home is the people. All the staff were friendly and helpful. In fact, you could tell that they made great efforts to deal with any concern we had or to help us with any part of our trip ( such as tours, storing luggage , etc) Hakan even offered to store our luggage for a few days while we took a trip to Cappadocia even though we were no longer registered at the hotel.We kept changing our minds about how long we would stay as we tried to work out our travel arrangements and this was never a problem. We had free meals at the restaurant and this was nice to have but their could be a little improvement here in portions and the fact that the meal was set every day as opposed to picking from the menu. I would have rather been able to use the menu and have a slight discount instead. The waitter was a great fellow and I must say all the staff were always pleasant and helpful. We were always made to feel at home. It was clear to me , when we stayed there, and also from the management responses in Trip Advisor that the owners take great pride in their hotel and will make every effort to deal with a concern if it is just brought to their attention.We would certainly recommed this hotel to anyone travelling to Istanbul. Rick and Gerry , Winnipeg Canada

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel in a quiet street”
Reviews.Author: Skyejo
Reviews.Content: My mother and I have just come back from the Angel's Home Hotel. We found it to have an excellent location, just a few moments walk to local restaurants and the sights. The highlight of this hotel for me was the fantastic view you get from the roof terrace, especially at night when the Blue Mosque is lit up! We stayed in the building with the reception and it is no trouble to take breakfast around the corner in their other building. Breakfast includes some fantastic yoghurt and the rather strange addition of cold chips (wasn't sure about that!) aswell as a selection of cereals, fruit, cheese, eggs etc. The street the hotel was on was very peaceful with not much passing traffic. We had a deluxe twin room which certainly lived up to the Angel name through its decoration!! The bedroom had everything you need, it was spacious, the wall paper was a little tatty in places but it was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was huge with a wonderfuly powerful shower and lots of extras like slippers and bathrobes. For the price, you get good value in this hotel. The terrace was not up and running when we were there but maybe this was because it was turnign wet and colder.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Angel's”
Reviews.Author: LondonLulabelle
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have just come back from a 5 day stay at the Angel's Home Hotel. I would recommend this hotel, which is clean, well equipped and has very helpful and charming staff. The decor is rather florrid - on the angel theme - but the rooms had everything we needed and were quiet. The location is excellent and it really is no effort at all, if you are in the main building, to make the 1 minute walk round the corner to the Angel's Home 2 restaurant for breakfast and dinner. Breakfast was an ample, help yourself affair, but with some curious offerings - alongside the regular fare - such as cold chips! Nevertheless, the staff were great - going out of their way to be helpful. As we had booked directly with the hotel and were staying 5 days, the hotel arranged for transportation to and from the airport which made everything go very smoothly. The only problem we encountered - which was not a problem of the Hotel's making - was a very menacing and unpleasant waiter at the nextdoor fish restaurant who harrassed and threatened us each time we passed. We mentioned this to the hotel in passing and they said that other customers had also complained and they would take it up with the management of the restaurant. I hope they do so.

Reviews.Title: “Devil's Roost at Angel's Home”
Reviews.Author: UCLATravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Angel's Home for several nights. The location was great, however I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. We set up a trap on the first day of our stay to check to see if hotel staff would go through our bags. We put the DO NOT DISTURB sign on the door during our whole stay. Mind you, we do not do this at every hotel, but an uncomfortable hunch made us feel uneasy. On several occasions (with the DO NOT DISTURB sign hung), hotel staff rummaged through our suitcases and backpacks. Unfortunately, we had to turn in our key EVERY time we left the hotel so management might not be involved. Since we paid for it on Expedia, we could not recoup any money for future nights so we ended up taking all of our valuables with us every time we left the room (even at breakfast). Further more, there was a peculiar "window" in our bathroom opposite our shower and above the toilet that opened up into a supply closet. The window had no lock and was easily opened. During our stay, we heard hotel staff in this closet multiple times. It was not a comforting experience. I recommend to hotel management to close off this window. I do not recommend this hotel. My husband and I are frequent travelers and this is the first hotel that we have not recommended. It was an uncomfortable feeling during our stay and we left feeling violated.

Reviews.Title: “Credit Card Fraud”
Reviews.Author: Grumpy60
Reviews.Content: I faxed a booking form to the hotel witth my credit cards details on it. I followed the fax with a telephone call but was told my fax had not been received. In exasperation I booked another hotel. My fax must have miraculously reappeared, because on the arrival day that I had put on the fax my VISA account was charged over Â£600.What a terrific Scam. I have been in contact with the Brothers since who deny the fact that they told me the fax had not arrived and completely ignored the fact that they did not sent me any kind of booking confirmation. Who am i to suggest you avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: walstric
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful short break in Istanbul last week and the hospitality at Angels Home played a big part in this. The hotel could not be more convenient, the room was well equipped and clean, all staff were courteous,and helpful and the food was superb. We will come again and will recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Get the Penthouse Suite -- Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: Timmeh!
Reviews.Content: Overall Angel's Home was wonderful: amazing view, very friendly and courteous staff, great free meals, and perfect location. Highly recommended for a young couple that wants to tour Sultanahment. We booked the Penthouse room (sea view) in the main hotel (there is also a second hotel around the corner) via the hotel's website. The staff replied quickly to my reservation request and all went smoothly. The hotel's shuttle driver was prompt and professional. Check-in was fine. The location is perfect for seeing the Sultanahmet sights. You are literally a 3-minute walk from the park separating Hagia Sophia and Sultanahmet mosque. Just a bit beyond that is the tram to get to Eminonu or Beyoglu. Keep in mind that the area gets pretty quiet at night -- there are very few bars and clubs nearby. If you interested in that scene, consider staying near Taksim and tramming it to Sultanahmet during the day. We were happy here. The room had an outstanding view of south Sultanahmet, the Bosporus, and the Asian side. Because the windows are so large, you can literally enjoy the view while laying in bed. The good-sized balcony was our favorite part of the room -- we ended each day sitting at the table sipping tea. Unfortunately if you end up with guests in the adjacent room, the only thing separating the two balcony is a gate. We didn't have to worry about this, though -- it was romantic and private. Very nice bathroom by Turkish standards: decent size, new fixtures, mid-sized shower/tub. Great towels/robes/slippers. The decor of the room (and the hotel overall) wasn't our style -- lots of gaudy reds and golds with angels and hearts everywhere -- but we honestly didn't care too much. Would have preferred some indirect lighting (i.e. shaded lamps) in the room rather than the exposed-bulb wall lamps. Not a big negative. The penthouse rate includes dinner (minus drinks) each everning, which we enjoyed twice. Above average food and service. Sultanahmet is known for mediocre & expensive restaurants, so this was a nice option when we didn't have the time/energy to venture across the Galata bridge. The free breakfasts were even better -- a huge spread of great traditional turkish fare in the garden room. Absolutely perfect way to start the days. The other Angel's Home building has a roof-top terrace with an outstanding view of the Sultanahment mosque. We had tea there one evening and had it all to ourselves -- very nice. Apparently they also have a breakfast there, so I recommend asking about it. Overall the service was excellent. Everyone was extremely friendly and professional. Spent quite a while talking with Ufuk and Kubi -- iyi gunler, guys! We had a few minor issues that the staff handled professionally and quickly. One minor complaint -- there is no iron in the room, and you may only use the hotel's while in the lobby. I understand the fire hazard, which the owner explained corteously, but I still would have preferred to take it back to the room. I had never seen this in any other hotel. Overall we loved our stay at Angel's Home. Highty recommended for a first visit by young couples that prefer the sights to partying. Be sure to get the Penthouse suite.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: aussie_bmh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Angel's Home for 2 nights (14/7, 15/7) at the beginning of our Turkey holiday and for 4 nights (7/8 - 10/8) at the end. We booked with an internet booking agency for our first stay, and emailed the hotel directly for the second stay. The reason for the latter was because only standard rooms can be booked with an agency and we wanted a higher standard room (mid-range) for our second (longer) stay. Angel's Home comprises two buildings a few minutes walk apart. One has the terrace restaurant where buffet breakfast for both buildings is served. The view from the terrace is great - blue mosque one side, Marmara Sea the other. The range and quality of breakfast food was very good. Our standard room was in this building. The room itself was compact, with little space for placing baggage. Nevertheless it was clean and overall we thought good value. We did have a bit of trouble trying to get the strange hot water system for the shower to work but as it was about 40 degrees outside it wasn't much of an issue (might be different in winter though!). The room for our second stay was in the second building. We had paid 15 euros per night extra for this room and expected something a little better (bigger) than our first room. If anything, it was more compact than the standard room and the design of the room was such that the only floorspace available for baggage was at the foot of the bed, making moving around the room very difficult. The only sitting room was the bed. The room was perhaps slightly better furnished than the standard room and had a normal shower hot water system, but we struggled to find any justification for the price difference. Otherwise, the hotel is very clean and very well located right in the heart of Sultanamet. The rooms have tea and coffee making facilities - a rarity in Turkey, we found. Our rooms were serviced daily. The staff are pleasant and the restaurant meals very good, if perhaps a little overpriced compared with other options in the area. We had one unfortunate incident at the end of our stay. Just before we retired on our last night I asked my wife for a 50 euro note to ensure I had enough cash to pay the hotel bill next morning (although I intended to use my lira if I had enough). This note is very similar in colour and size to the Turkish 50 lira note. My wife and I, coming from Australia, had not dealt with either currency before and had decided to use lira throughout our trip, keeping our supply of euros quite separate and to use for currency exchange. Next morning I counted out cash for the bill and found I had just enough lira to pay for it. On the tram to our next location my wife asked if I had used the 50 euros. I had completely forgotten she had given it to me and now realised why I had had enough lira to pay the bill - one of the notes I had handed over thinking it was 50 lira was in fact 50 euros. I am surprised that the cashier didn't notice the difference. The lost value was insufficient to justify turning around and trying to recover the money, but the incident has, unfortunately, probably clouded our view of our stay at Angel's Home.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice staff but the OWNER????”
Reviews.Author: melgares
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 12 nights and I have to agree the location is good. The hotel "staff" is absolutley what makes the place they are all so nice and helpful. The rooms are just ok and adequate....do not expect much more than 3 stars on the facilities. The terrace views are stunning but the condition of the terrace and the GYM is sad because they could be so much better. The management is obviously too cheap to spend the money to make the improvements. The last thing I would say is that the cats are a BIG problem three litters were in the lobby when we arrived. On the last night we were there we left our third story window open and when we returned the mother cat and three kittens were in our room. So expect another 10 stray cats running around the hotel when you arrive. You can be sure you will see the TOM cat spraying his scent all around the hotel. So if you do not like cats do not stay in this hotel. The last thing I would advise is to stay away from the Manager/Owner he is the kind of guy who smiles as he takes advantage of you. We asked if we could move to a larger room when it came available and he did not even respond to our request.

Reviews.Title: “A very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: MickDaniel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have jus returned from an enjoyable stay at this hotel but were disappointed that it did not live up to expectations. The staff are very frienly and helpful and the location is excellent - close to all the major attractions of Sultanahmet and the really wonderful restaurants. Our room was a good size, but was rather dark and dreary. The shower bath was badly sealed and in need of attention. We were very disappointed that breakfast was adequate and only served on the roof top terrace on our last day and we had to walk across to a second hotel building for breakfast on our first two days. Our biggest complaint was the condition of the roof top terrace. The tables and chairs were grubby, a mixture of old plastic furniture and rusty wrought iron. It was a good idea to have large cushions to relax on, but they were dirty and you had to share them with the cats who liked to use the plant pots as their litter tray. The view was very good, but the terrace area needs a complete overhaul and investment in new furniture and the cats need to be discouraged. The steps up to the terrace our very steep and would not be suitable for old or disabled people. In general we felt that the whole hotel was due for an overhaul and had seen better days. We will not be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great views”
Reviews.Author: clouds111
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Angel for a long weekend at the end of June and I would truely recommend this hotel to anyone, whether on a budget or not. It has great views from the terrace overlooking the Blue Mosque and Marmara Sea, they'll even lend you their binoculars for a closer look! The hotel is about 5-10 minute stroll from the main 3 sights in Sultanahmet - The Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and Topkapi Palace. We arrived after midnight due to a delayed flight but despite the time the staff were still friendly and willing to show you around the hotel. The room was quite small but has everything you need - tea/coffee maker, satellite tv, dressing gowns, slippers, toiletries and shower (no bath). The rooms were spotlessly clean (cleaned every day). The hotel rooms and reception are set away from the restaurant/breakfast area but is only a minute walk around the corner. If you request it at reception you can have your breakfast served on the terrace which is what we did every morning. They will serve a cold selection plate - eggs, cheese, bread, cold meat and much more, which is plenty to get you started. This is a great hotel, perfect location, helpful/friendly staff oh and not forgetting the resident cats and kittens!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and really pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: NewTrips
Reviews.Content: Stayed June 27-July 1, 2007 Very pleasant place for the moderate budget traveller. In the Sultanahmet with easy access to the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Cistern, Topapki Palace, and a short walk down to the Eminonu ferry terminals, Angel's Home was a very easy place to stay. Breakfast was excellent with a lot of traditional choices and fresh fruits and vegetables -- and I didn't really mind the powdered coffee. My room was very small but pleasant (a little musty but not bad) but I saw other rooms that were larger. Rooftop deck was very nice with magnificent views of the Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Bosphorus, and Sea of Marmara. Highly recomend getting out of the Sultanahmet and into the more modern parts of the city including the Taksim Square and Beyoglu areas, across the Bosphorus to the Asian side to Uskugar, and the posher areas like Ortokoy and Nisantasi. Also, for a really cheap "Bosphorus Tour" just hop on one of the regular communter ferries at Eminonu and ride all of the stops for only 1.30 lira. Check the schedules at [--]. As a single traveller, I would definitely stay at Angel's Home again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fil0
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Angels Suite room in late May. The room was very nice and the hosts were very friendly and helpful. We were travelling with our 2 young sons and they were able to sleep on the sofa bed quite nicely. The location was perfect for exploring, in the heart of the Sultahahmet and just minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. We couldn't have a better location. Also the hosts were very child friendly. The room was roomy enough for our family and very nicely decorated in traditional decor. The only drawback was a very tiny bathroom, but it did have a very nice shower with a separate sauna (although we didn't use that). There were also some kind of flying ants that were in the room at night. We didn't mention it to the hosts but they must have noticed it because we could tell they had sprayed the room toward the end of our stay. Our kids loved playing with the hotel cats. The view from the rooftop terrace is phenomenal! We really had a good time there and had no problems with the hotel. I would recommend the Angels Suite, definitely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Hugged by ancient History”
Reviews.Author: Lucite
Reviews.Content: Angel's Home Hotel has the best location for exploring old Istanbul. It is situated within easy walking distance of many of Istanbul's ancient structures. This is a city that has so much to see and experience. The hotel's hosts are most gracious and helpful. My husband and I had a very comfortable room and breakfasted every morning (5 of them) on the roof top in full view of the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus and Golden Horn. One rainy evening we dined in the tiny roof-top restaurant; other great dining experiences are within walking distance. For the energetic, a walk to the Gallata Tower across the Golden Horn and onto Taksim Square and the Military Museum; well worth the time and effort. The public transit system is fairly user friendly. We would definitely go back to Istanbul and stay at the Angel's Home Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “recent visit”
Reviews.Author: w0ndering
