Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in the main building, left the city and returned for another 4 nights in the second building around the corner (prebooked at a time of little choice in the city).Overall not bad and the staff was all lovely and cheerful nothing really to worry about if you're booked there...but... For the price you could probably do better in terms of ambiance and cleanliness especially in #2 building--found the dirty carpets really depressing and I'm not that picky; another guest was trying to leave early due to heavy dust in his own carpet. in the first building which is the one shown on the website photos with cute decor, my room was so small I could not actually see the carpet but for an inch or two around the bed. The second room was larger but with some peeling paper, broken door sills, and generally run down--a kettle was supplied but no access to anywhere to plug it in, etc. But note that the transfer from the airport is definitely NOT free but costs 30 euros. anyway it's reasonably quiet and the shower works and when i was there included a litter of cute kittens in the lobby to play with.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay in.”
Reviews.Author: jwvraets
Reviews.Content: If you are visitng Istanbul's Sultanahmet district you cannot go wrong staying at the Angel's Home. Very good facilities, great restaurant (fabulous breakfasts) wonderful staff and right next to hotels costing far more for similar rooms. The rooftop terrace on the main hotel (there are 2 buidings with the second one just around the corner and that one is where the glassed in courty restaurant is located) is a great place to relax with the Blue mosque about 200 meters away as a backdrop. The hotel(s) are a very short amble (3-5 minutes) from the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sophia, the Topkapi and the sea of Marmara and all the "must sees" in this part of Istanbul. Absolutely fabulous locattion for your vist. We started off there for our trip in Feb 2007 and liked it so much we booked there for the return leg of our trip. Excellent value. I recommend it to everyone I know thinking of visiting Istanbul and It would be my first choice if/when I return. Bill Vraets - Grimsby, Ontario - CANADA

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent staff, view, location and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: senPL86
Reviews.Content: We stayed in march and I absolutely loved my stay in Istanbul that much more bc of this hotel. The staff is amazing, super friendly and very helpful and recommended cool places to go at night and They arranged our shuttles, tours and dinners for us as well. Free internet in the lobby and if it's busy play with the cats (sooo cute) and have some free tea! The breakfast was amazing, lots to eat and very filling. The location is superb, right in the midst of shops, food, and the main icons. I would go back to istanbul just to shop and stay here again! loved it

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: naveedk
Reviews.Content: Great location. All the sites are walking distance. Cute little family run hotel. The rooms are small, but comfortable. We even had bathrobes in our bathrooms which I loved. The breakfast was good. Overall, i would recommend this place. The only minus is that they are a bit stingy with the heat. It was quite cold the week we were in istanbul, and the first night we had no heat. They did finally turn the heat on but we had to ask at least 4 times.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Johnnyten
Reviews.Content: There is no better spot in Istanbul for a hotel than this one. The hotel itself is nice, clean, good atmosphere, good facilities. Breakfast is also really good and the staff are absolutely super friendly. Highly recommended for a city trip in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Should be 4*”
Reviews.Author: audi21
Reviews.Content: An absolutely amazing hotel in a lovely city. We arrived to Sabiha Gokcen Airport and took a 1hr taxi ride to the hotel which cost Â£30. Alternatively, take the bus to Kadikoy for Â£2 then a ferry to Istanbul Eminou (50p) then a taxi to the hotel because it might be hard to find at first but very easy once you have seen it. (Â£2 taxi). Staff: We arrived to the very hospitable staff of the hotel were we checked in within a few minutes. We had booked 2 rooms, one for me and my wife and one for my mother in law. They placed me and my wife on the 3rd floor and my mother in law on the ground floor. We asked if anything could be done to have both rooms on the same floor and i felt they really went out of their way to help us. They rearranged rooms for other customers who were about to visit and placed us on the same floor. I had heard so much about their service from tripadvisor beforehand and can now advertise about it myself. Room: The rooms were almost identical, with a double bed, a tv, a safe, a minibar and shower in each room. The bed was very comfortable and had no trouble sleeping as if it were my own. The tv had over 30 channels of which about 5 are English. I was able to watch all premiership matches on tv aswell as champions league matches. The safe was well sized for your passports and valuables. The minibar had drinks which were not overly priced. On the last night, my wife got thirsty so she had a bottle of water from the minibar. When we checked out they said it was on them and did not charge us for it. The toilet had amneties that you would usually see in a 4 star hotel. These included a shaving kit, toothbrush and toothpaste, bathrobes, slippers, a powerful hairdryar, shampoo and a sewing kit. Breakfast: Breakfast was served in the Angel's home 2 which is about a 30 second walk from the hotel. The breakfast variety included scrambled egg, boiled eggs, cold meats, olives, cereals, jams, teas, sausages, spring rolls.... etc..... basically....more than enough. Location: 5 mins walk to blue mosque, Topkaki palace, Aya Sofia and the closest tram station. Excellent location in a lovely quiet area, although a few minutes walk to the hustle and bustle of Istanbul. 10mins walk from the Grand Bazaar and a 15min taxi ride to Taksim Square ( Â£3 taxi ride). Advise: make sure the taxi meter says Gunduz between 6am and midnight. If it does not say gunduz then they have it on the night rate and you will pay 1.5x the fare. Services: There was internet in the lobby and wireless throughout the hotel as well as a very well equipped gym. There was a beautiful seating area in the roof were you are served complimentary tea or coffee. The weather was too cold for us while we were there to enjoy it. The hotel staff arranged our taxi back to the airport at a very reasonable price in a people carrier. (I will not disclose the price, but it was very similar to the yellow taxi's and much more comfortable, so i would advise to use the hotel to arrange your transportation). On our way to the airport, our driver received a call from the hotel saying i had forgotten to return the room keys. I left the keys with the driver who returned the keys to the hotel. This was an added benefit of using their taxi driver(who was a lovely person). Finally to the hotel staff. Thanks a lot for a really wonderful experience. I will definately not hesitate to visit you again. It was my mother in law's first trip abroad in many years and you truly made it a memorable one by your service and by placing us on the same floor. Sorry for leaving to the airport with the rooms keys. I was too sad to be leaving that i wanted an excuse to come back. The taxi driver you sent us to the airport with was brilliant. I hope you use him regularly.

Reviews.Title: “4 Thumbs up for Angel's Home”
Reviews.Author: asiantraveler-TRIP
Reviews.Content: We have traveled to lots of places, cities and seen alot of difference faces..but our trip to Istanbul was by far one of the "BEST" ever in our travel experiences. It has alot to do with the impeccable services that received by the owners and staffs of Angel's Home Hotel in Istanbul. We stayed for 8 days and everyday we were greeted with a cup of tea in the lobby both in the afternoon and evening without asking now that's "walking an extra miles" for your guests. The location of this hotel is excellent - is walking distance to all the historical sites namely the famous Haghia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar and the many Hammas. Is close to the major public transport. The Tramway and the Metro is very near by the hotel making it a breeze to travel around Istanbul and is the cheapest form of travel each way is 1.30 lira. Angel's staffs and their owners will make your stay the most enjoyable stay. Rooms were kept clean and made everyday we came back from our outings. The homely atmosphere was what we love most. From helpful and smiling staffs down to the kittens in the lobby make our stay so enjoyable. The hotel is GAY friendly.From making necessary arrangement for many dinners and tours by the staffs at the desk made our trip stress free. And they do it without hesitation,always delivere their goods. !!! An excellent boutique hotel in the heart of Istanbul. Keep it up and we will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Palmtree216
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay. The staff were friendly and very helpful. They spoke english and helped us have a good time in Istanbul. The rooms were nice and clean. The location was good but not central. The restaurant was fair. I would recommend this hotel and it was very reasonably priced. A great bargain on a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: kb61263
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Angels suite, which is more expensive than the other rooms, but I think worth the extra. The sauna and steam shower were nice, if small (each is about the size of a telephone box). The controls were quite complicated but we managed to work them out. The staff offered to come and show us if we couldnt. Breakfast is at Angel 2, a few metres around the corner, the variety was good, buffet. A small complaint is the smoking at breakfast, obviously this is something which is generally considered normal in turkey. Any small problems we had were dealt with promptly and efficiently by the staff. (corked bottle of wine, electricity supply tripped off once, sauna bucket split - all sorted before we had to ask again) There was a kettle and tea and coffee in the room, and available free upstairs on the roof terrace bar (we didnt use this much, the weather wasnt up to it) we WOULD stay again

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Nephelim
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was friendly and helpful; food for breakfast and dinner were great. All historical attractions were easily within walking distance. Great location for shopping, local eateries, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelersx2
Reviews.Content: First of all I just want to say that Turkey is an amazing place to visit. The people are wonderful and helpful, and just want you to enjoy their country. Angels Home was the nicest place we stayed. The rooms were very clean and adorable in decor. The beds were like heaven. This was the first place we stayed and also the last placed we stayed. The staff at the hotel were great. They made you feel like part of the family and were always watching out for your best interest. We arrived early (about 9:30am) from an all night bus ride from Selcuk and we weren't supposed to get our room until noon. They invited us right in for breakfast and before we were done eating they had a room ready for us! That was the best sleep I've ever had. Great location as well. We walked to all the attractions as we were so close. If you're goin to go to Istanbul and stay in Sultanahmet, stay at Angel's Home. They will take care of you!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, especially for the price”
Reviews.Author: TDog47
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay at the Angels Home Hotel. The neighborhood is great for visiting the Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia. We stayed at Angels Home for one nite on the way back through Istanbul. Check in was a little annoying as the guy at the desk acted like we were idiots. He was nice the rest of the time we were there. The cats everywhere were kind of a little too much for my liking, but not a huge deal. The room was great. The bed was comfortable and for the price($100 a nite or so), you can't go wrong. Would stay here again if I were to go back to the same neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Istanbul thanks to the Angel's Home”
Reviews.Author: santoroj
Reviews.Content: We always had been excited to visit Istanbul, but frankly didn't know what to expect of the city, hotels, and the people. We immediately were charmed by the Angels Hotel. We smiled at the "honeymoon suite" furnishings, and we were wowed by the view of the Blue Mosque from the rooftop restaurant. However, the staff were truly what made us cherish our experience in Istanbul. They were unfailingly helpful, warm, and informative. Our children, ages five and six, were very comfortable with everyone, and loved playing with the new kittens that lived in the lobby. The location was ideal, being only a five or ten minute walk to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. The neighborhood was quiet yet captured the atmosphere of Istanbul - we could not have imagined this in a larger, more commercial hotel. We spent three wonderful days at the hotel, and by the end felt that we were leaving friends. There was no better impression of the charm of Istanbul and the warmth and hospitality of the Turkish people than we got from the people at the Angel's Home. Thank you for making our trip so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel, amazing location, friendly staff = great deal”
Reviews.Author: annmarie1122
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from 4 nights in Istanbul from Nov. 22-26 staying at Angel's Home 2. We are both 32 years old. When we arrived we were met at the airport by a friendly man holding a sign with my name and our free ride to the hotel. Our flight arrived an hour early so we were surpised that our ride was there - guess they checked our flight status online, whcih impressed me. Along the way he pointed out some sites for us and I precticed my few words in Turkish. When we arrived at the hotel Angel's home, we were told that we should go over the Angel's home 2. They brought our luggage over for us. I had originally booked a standard double room at Angel's home for 49 a night but they upgraded us to double room at Angel's home 2 -- a room with a view and what I believe wass much larger than the room I originally booked. When we checked out it was 59 a night. The only complaint I had was that this upgraded room had the typical European tub with the hand-held shower, and I had booked at the original Angel's home for the standing stall shower - however, that being said, it was not a big deal because this tub had shower doors (unlike many that I have used before in Europe) so it wasnâ€™t as awkward as I had thought and the view with hearing the prayer call more than made up for it - so we decided to stay in that room. And I am sure that if I had asked to be moved back to a room with a shower stall they would have provided it to me without question. The staff at the hotel are very friendly and always willing to answer any questions, suggest places to go and call cabs for us and let us in at 3am when we came back from clubs and still wake us up at 8am!! The breakfast was plentiful and had a wide variety of buffet items and because the weather was so nice we ate on the roof of Angel's home which was beautiful!! I loved the juice and the eggs with the sausages!!! Could not get enough!! Our room was big and very confortable and was always spotlessly cleaned. Our room was the gold colored fabric room with curtains to block the light, a safe and mini bar and a very comfy bed. The beds were 2 single beds, but we just pushed them together and were fine. I think the housekeeper noticed that I needed extra hangers for my clothes and the next day I had 5 more in the closet. The internet access was a huge perk. Cute little additions, like slippers, robes and travel kits with toothpaste etc. I even noticed that there were binoculars on a table on the roof of Angel's home for us to use - to me, little touches like that make a hotel unique and welcoming. The location of this hotel could not be better - perfect for exploring all the major sites and easy to get to the "Kennedy highway" to get to other destinations by Taksi (taxi). The cats at the hotel are friendly and cute and added a "home" touch. The ONLY complaint is that the bathrooms would sometimes smell like sulfur, however I am sure that this is NOT unique to this hotel and is just the water system in the city similar to places like in Italy. I would just spray perfume once in a while and the problem was solved or just shut the bathroom door. I really enjoyed my stay there and would highly recommend the hotel and will stay again when I return - and I will!!! Anyone looking for a great deal will find it here. You get a lot for your money and it deserves its high rating on Tripadvisor even though it is not in the same category as let's say The Four Seasons. I have read some negative posts re: this hotel on tripadvisor which seem to be based on the fact that this hotel has such a high rating so people assume they are a five star hotel. It's not. But when you compare what you get with what you paid - it's an amazing deal and tries just as hard to be a 5 star. This was def. the best overall deal I have ever gotten in Europe. I highly recommed it to people looking for a great deal, who want an amazing location, a friendly staff and comfortable rooms. I absolutely LOVED this city. I will post a review in the forum soon. Thanks Angel's home for a great introduction into your fabulous city!!! AnnMarie & Jason

Reviews.Title: “Visit Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Shiloh25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Angel's Home Hotel for 4 nights in early October. We had contacted them directly via the internet for the reservations. We also got a gratis ride from the airport to the hotel, which was nice. The hotel is in a great location. It's close to many of the sights visitors want to see, but on a quiet sidestreet. We slept very well,. Great restaurants are only a few blocks away. You can also pick up the Istanbul tram just a few blocks from the hotel. The rooms are clean, modern, and equipped with pretty much everything you could ask for. Everything worked, and the room was in good shape and was well cleaned everyday. The breakfast is good and is served on an outdoor rooftop balcony with some great views. The staff is very helpful. Hakan helped us with tours, sightseeing questions, and arranged a very early ride to the airport for us - 3:15 a.m.! The other staff were friendly and helpful, too. There are several kitty cats hanging out at the hotel, so if you like cats, it will be an added bonus, but there are not so prevalent that they would bother someone who is not particular to cats, either. Another note - we had a great time in Istanbul. People were friendly and helpful and we were never hassled once for being Americans. Do be careful of the carpet salesman. It bothered us the first day, but then we learned how to avoid them and we had no problem after that. The sellers in the grand bazaar and spice market were not particularly bothersome, so I recommend you visit these sights even if you have some trepidation about it. Of course, the Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque are breathtaking and you must visit them. The day tour offered at a discount thru the hotel is also a good deal. You get to go to the Asian side, which was the first time we had ever been to that continent! Finally, a slightly less visited spot is the Chora Church, which will require a taxi ride. It is a Byzantine era orthodox church filled with jaw-dropping frescos and mosaics. The old city walls are not far from there, so you can see those on the same trip. The hotel Angel's Home treated us very well, and we would -will -definitely stay there on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “We miss you!”
Reviews.Author: Newdays
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I ('Mum') stayed at Angels Home 1 for a week in mid October. It offers a perfect location from which to explore this exciting and fascinating city. The hotel was clean and comfortable and we loved the powerful shower! The staff were always friendly, welcoming, polite and far more helpful than one would often find - helping us with several unusual challenges including carrying a very large and heavy wooden box into our room, finding and using a number of tools to prise it open and then putting it back together! By the end of the week we considered them to be our friends. Our room was cleaned thoroughly each day (though not hoovered under the beds!), the towels replaced and the tea, coffee, soap etc replenished. We did not have a view from our room, but enjoyed being on the ground floor as the hotel's adopted family of kittens would often visit us! It was great to have virtually unlimited free access to the internet in the lobby. We enjoyed the breakfast, taken at the sister hotel - but a little more variety would be welcomed for guests staying more than a few days. We enjoyed the slightly unusual decor, the cushions, pictures, books and ornaments which add a cheerful, homely, individual feel. If we ever return to Istanbul we look forward to staying with you again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: nativnewyorker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Angel's Home on our way into and out of Turkey from the U.S. The location in the historic part of the city was within walking distance of everything we wanted to see, and the rates were quite reasonable given the amenities of the hotel. To begin with, there was the excellent buffet breakfast on the roof with the view of the roofs and the water. Next, our room was quite large, with perfect climate control and a very big, comfortable bed. The curtains stopped all light, and there was very little noise at night - we were in the back, so there wasn't any view, either. But we spent no time during the day there. The bathroom was the best of the trip - a full size bath, with superb water pressure. The roof terrace is open at night, so you can go up and look at the moon on the water or over the Blue Mosque. The owners were also very helpful when our car rental company reserved a car in the wrong location, and had them bring the car to the hotel. I would definitely recommend Angel's Home to anyone coming to Istanbul. As for the cats on the premises - I don't think one can escape them anywhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “The Great City of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Gerbecks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Angel's Home for three nights at the end of Sept. It is a great value in just the right location for seeing the sights. I had booked the hotel directly with the brothers, and when at the last minute we had to make a change, due to my fault, on two rooms, they were able to accommodate us. They were always very prompt in communicating with us via email. The management was very friendly and helpful, without being overbearing. The whole staff was great. The rooftop provided great vistas along with a very good breakfast. The city of Istanbul is a fabulous place to visit. The people are lovely, the history of the city is just wonderful. Everyone should make this a must see destination. And stay with the brothers at the Angel's Home Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeding Expectations at Angels Home”
Reviews.Author: tgarrigu
Reviews.Content: We found Angel's Home on Tripadivsor, and were pleased to find the staff friendly, helpful and have a great overall experience in Instanbul. Staying 3 nights, the hotel arranged our free pick-up from the Airport, which was very nice after a couple weeks of traveling. The location of the hotel is excellent, the staff was very friendly, internet was available, and breakfast was wonderful on the terrace - which had a great view!

Reviews.Title: “Angel Delight”
Reviews.Author: dode&mo
Reviews.Content: We had four nights in the 'Angel's Suite' during Ramazan. The suite itself was spotlessly clean, comfortable and very spacious with a private balcony, amazing multi-head shower, sauna, bathrobes and slippers. The rooftop terrace has excellent views of both the blue mosque and the sea of marmara with binoculars provided, and a covered area in the centre for chilly evenings. Unfortunatley the breakfast area of the terrace was closed for the season and we had to walk (2 minutes) to the garden in Angel's Home Two. The staff were very helpful, and offered us an itinery for our days. The location was fabulous and the area (Sultanahmet) is the most convenient for all the sites which are in easy walking distance. (unlike other reviewers we found no hassle from hawkers or peddlars and the cafes and bars were relaxed with excellent food) The nightlife during Ramazan was positively buzzing with food and trinket stalls lining the square and great marquees set for ifter. It was an experience we will never forget, even though we were non-muslim tourists we were made to feel so welcome on their holy festival. All in all we would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Miguel0021
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Angel Home for four nights in the 19th of May. The hotel is absolutely fantastic! We booked a room with a view of the Blue Mosque which is absolutely worth the view. The hotel staff is absolutely helpful and outstanding.The quality of service is suited to five star hotels. We highly recommend Angel Home to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Culture and Grand Prix”
Reviews.Author: RowTom
Reviews.Content: My son and I were first time visitors to Turkey and Istanbul and came to mix sightseeing and the Turkey Grand Prix. The hotel was very easy to deal with and was a perfect base for our stay. We were met at the airport and taken to the hotel which is situated between the main sites in Sultanahmet and the Sea of Marmarra. Everything is in within very close walking distance and the area is a charming mix of small hotels, town houses, shops and restaurants. It is a very peaceful area and a nice contrast to the bustle of the main City. The hotel provided everything we wanted and the staff were first rate and very welcoming. We felt very much at home during our stay and have some great memories of our visit. The highlight of the hotel for us was the roof terrace restaurant that has superb views of the sea and the Blue Mosque and is a great place to sit and unwind with a cooling breeze blowing the heat of the day away. We were also taken with the kittens that seem to inhabit the reception area and play all day for the visitors! The hotel organised air conditioned transportation to and from Istanbul Park where the Grand Prix was being held and the arrangements worked very well on both the Saturday and Sunday. I do not know when I will be in Istanbul next but I do know where I will be staying!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: verge
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights at Angel's Home in mid-May 2006. From my perspective, Angel's has a perfect location near all of the famous Sultanhamet sights, as well as some less know, but perhaps more colorful areas. The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, and the Maramara Sea are only short walks from Angel's. But walk in other directions and and you will seel delapitated nieghborhoods of Sultanhamet. This gives you a flavor for the character of the Old Istanbul. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful and the 24hr free internet is a plus. I was travelling alone and first got a "triple" room in the old part of the hotel with no deadbolt lock (somewhat disconcerting). They then "upgraded" me to the newer part of the hotel which was much nicer and had all the luxuries of home (inlcuding a deadbolt). All in all, it was well worth the money, particularly for solo travels. I'm not sure I'd bring my family there unless I was sure that our room would have a deadbolt lock.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: war8470
Reviews.Content: WS from New York City My wife and I spent 3 nights at the Angels Home Hotel the beginning of August. We stayed in the Suite, which was a very large, nicely furnished room. The only problem was the bed; the mattress sloped toward the middle. We informed the management after the second night and hope that it will be changed for future guests. Breakfast was more than adequate, though I would suggest that the management serve brewed coffee rather than the instant kind. We had dinner on the roof terrace the first night; it was inexpensive and adequate, though nothing to look forward to. The cats and kittens that live in the hotel, and throughout Istanbul, were delightful. My wife and I thought of taking one back to New York, but since we already have 3 cats we decided against it. The two brothers who own the hotel speak English well and are very helpful. The location of the hotel in the Sultanahmet area is perfect. Everything is within easy walking distance. My wife and I had dinner one night at the restaurant in the Four Seasons, which is supposed to be one of the best restaurants in Istanbul. Skip it. The food was good, but not great. And the prices were astronomical. A better restaurant is at the Armada hotel. And the views from the roof terrace were extraordinary: the sea of Marmara on one side and an amazing view of the Blue Mosque on the other. Istanbul itself is amazing, and the people are so friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel, super position”
Reviews.Author: percytheparrot
Reviews.Content: Fantastic position - views of the Blue Mosque and the Marmara sea Really helpful staff, even when off-duty - gave super recommendations for restaurant. Fantastic ride to airport in Chevy - and the hotel owner even came back to deliver a mobile left on back seat - triple room generous, double room a bit tight - overall a really pleasant and memorable experience 9/10.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: expatDublin
Reviews.Content: I was very glad I stayed in this boutique hotel in Istanbul because it's a place that makes you feel welcome. The owners are very helpful, and the rooms comfortable and clean. And there are little angels tucked away everywhere, which make you smile. The food was also very good. From the terrace, you can see the Blue Mosque on one side and the water on the other. There are binoculars up there so guests can spot the dolphins.

Reviews.Title: “Good rates, reasonable value, Bohemian charm”
Reviews.Author: Seessee
Reviews.Content: Angel's Home has a bohemian charm. Stayed there at the end of May 2006; 69 Euros (about $90) for Standard Single. Once two homes joined together, it is now a small, very relaxed easy-going inn, ideally located on a quiet street in Sultanahmet within less than 5 minutes walk to Blue Mosque or Hagia Sophia, and with surprisingly good rooftop views of the Blue Mosque and Sea of Marmara. It is two blocks and a different universe away from the touristy atmosphere of Sultanahmet. The staff is small but very friendly, gracious, helpful - each speaking English and knowledgeable about the city. Unexpectedly, I had to leave early; and although I'd paid a full deposit on four nights, they very generously refunded me for the nights I didn't stay. Breakfast is served on the rooftop terrace, where they offer a large healthy buffet you can enjoy in sun or shade. It's an older building and my room only perfunctory, but the bathroom was recently remodeled with white tile and new plumbing fixtures. (Room safe is insufficient.) With such close proximity to the Blue Mosque come the fairly loud nightly calls to prayer, though this is nearly unavoidable in Sultanahmet. If you are a light sleeper, request a room away from stairway traffic and gym. I stayed in Room #27 on the ground floor and found hall noise hard to ignore. Room dÃ©cor is saturated red and hearts, as you'll read in Lonely Planet and elsewhere, but it underscores the warmth of the total experience. While more vagabond than upscale, Angel's Home offers reasonable value and good rates for the Sultanahmet area.

Reviews.Title: “We were family!!”
Reviews.Author: Studiusbagus
Reviews.Content: My GF and I stayed at Angels home over the christian holidays, me being an American, she being Persian we had separate suites. First of all, I cannot say enough about the owners and their families, or the staff. Our rooms were very clean, the automatic lights worked perfectly and all I had to do was mention a need and I got it. Hakan and Okan are the perfect owners in terms of personality. The showers were very nice, plenty hot with lots of pressure, the rooms were very comfortable and the balcony, although not impressive in view, had a nice breeze all the time. As an American waking up to 5 Azzans calling for prayers at 5:45 the first day was a shock, after that I used them to be my alarm clock and even found comfort in them at times. The staff was so helpful in everything, they even went walking with me to go food shopping....Why food shopping??? They actually let me take over the kitchen!! Hakan and his wife were kind enough to join us for dinner on the beautiful terrace that had breathtaking views of the bosphorus. Then there are the cats...Angel.....and Angel. The cats were very well behaved, loved to cuddle if you wanted to, and left when you didn't. The gym was small and just enough to keep one maintained, the stairs were never an issue with us. But again, the service was phenominal, we would get great suggestions, then when we decided they would call a cab for us, tell them where we were going and warn the driver about trying to be crafty. Now for my embarrassment.....we stayed for 2 weeks, at the end of the stay they made me cry...(I am a 49 year old man) the staff purposely dropped my bags at the other end of the lobby, asked me to check them, when I stood up, I turned to find the family, and the staff from both shifts had lined up come to say goodbye. As we were heading towards the 55 Chevy to take me to the airport they threw glasses of water in the street behind me, when i asked why, hakan told me it was a turkish custom meaning you came as smooth as water and we want you back the same way. Upon leaving I got a manly hug from Hakan and this..."We get some guests that stay with us and we never see again, we get some that come back and we remember them, you we will never forget" Thats it!! I lost it!! If there was ever a place I hated leaving, it was the Angels Home Hotel. My GF recently went back on business to a hotel her company picked, she was in the neighborhood and decided to stop in, they remembered her completely and asked about me too. Thats family!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay :o)”
Reviews.Author: CollinsHols
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night break with friends in Istanbul, staying in the Angel Home Hotel. We had deluxe rooms with balcony. Bed was very large and very comfortable, great power shower in bathroom too. They also offer 24 hour room service, and even picked us up from the airport. We normally stay in 5 star hotels, and booked this purely on good reviews that we had seen on Trip Advisor, we were not disappointed. I also wondered if the review placed on 16th of June was actually for the same hotel. The hotel is only 3 floors, (not six, as this reviewer mentioned). Everytime I walked up or down the stairs the lights worked perfectly well. Yes, there are cats, very playful too, and I certainly did not see any dogs anywhere near the hotel. The views from the roof top terrace are breathtaking and a great place to enjoy a drink, and our breakfast every morning. Nothing was too much trouble for them, they even put the tv on the terrace so we could watch the England v Portugal game on Saturday evening, (we forgive you for shouting Portugal everytime you walked past!!!) I liked the location of the hotel, very quiet street, so a peaceful nights sleep. There are a number of restuarants within easy walking distance of the hotel. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel or Istanbul to anyone that was thinking of visiting. I hope to return to Istanbul again, only for longer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Angel's Home was heavenly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spend a wonderful week in Instanbul and much of the thanks should go to Hakan and Okan, the charming and helpful brothers who own and manage the Angels' Home hotel. Angel's Home is not a large, corporate hotel chain, where one hotel is indistinguishable from all the others. One Marriott is virtually identical to all Marriotts. One Hyatt is exactly like all other Hyatts (and like most Marriotts.) For travelers who like that sort of thing, Istanbul certainly has plenty of them and they are doubtess fine -- uniformly, predictably, antiseptically fine and when you wake up in the morning, you'll have no clue as to whether you are in Istanbul or Cleveland. But our experience at Angel's Home was truly special. Yes, indeed, the dining room is on the rooftop terrace of the three-story building (not six as an unhappy colleague seems to have believed). And from there the views are simply stunning -- the justly famous Blue Mosque in one direction, the Marmara Sea and the Bosphorus in the other. To eat outside in fine weather on such a rooftop is a true delight. In fact, we found during our week in Istanbul that a rooftop terrace was the point of pride, and justly so, for many restaurants, hotels, rug dealers and all sorts of other commerce. Day or night, to have a meal or a cup of tea in such an environment is breathtakingly beautful. And WHAT we ate was at least as nice as where we ate it. The cook at Angel's Home provided excellent meals -- an enormous variety of breakfast foods, gratis by the way, ranging from scrambled eggs and juice, fresh fruit, breads and tea or coffee for those who want to start the day with familiar American fare, to far more interesting dishes with aubergines, carrots, and other things I could not replicate but would love to eat again. And a most attentive waiter comes round the tables with some sort of cheese-filled pancakes that were spendid. Evening meals at Angel's Home include either a full menu or a choice-of-three entrees on a prix fixe menu. Depending on how many nights you say, one or more of those meals is included as well. We savored our evening meals at the Angel's Home and found the quality of the food at least as good as that of restaurants in the area costing much more. As to the decor -- one person's gracious elegance is another's oppressiveness, I suppose. Because the building itself was once the home of a Turkish admiral, whose wife's name translates to "Angel," the angel motif is everywhere -- tastefully done, we thought, but if angels aren't your thing, well, there ARE a lot of little angels in around the place. I can't imagine anyone objecting. And with the angels come lots of dark red drapes and bed spreads, red, heart-shaped throw pillows and ottomans and the like. We found it charming. And yes, most of the lights in Angel's Home are connected to motion detectors -- you enter a hallway and the lights come on. We found that to be true all over Istanbul and feel that to be a very good solution to squandering many kwh of electricity keeping empty hallways brightly lit. Other bits: There is a small but serviceable gym on the ground floor, Internet-enabled computers in the lobby for guest use 24 hours a day and the whole place is wi-fi enabled, for those of us who can't venture out without our laptops. But overwhelmingly, at Angel's Home as, really, anywhere, the most important element is the courtesy and professionalism of the staff. From owner to housekeeper, from cook to waiter to bellhop, we found everyone at the hotel to be as gracious and as helpful as one could possibly imagine. Hakan himself even drove us out to the airport at 6:30 a.m. (and in his beloved and beautiful 1955 Chevrolet!). Then, at the airport, we needed a couple of phone numbers for our next desination. We couldn't find an internet connection, so I called the hotel and Okan happily looked up the website of our next desination and gave us the phone numbers. Try that at the Hyatt. Cats? Yep. There are cats in the lobby, maybe cats elsewhere, too, I can't attest to that. There are cats all over Istanbul. We found them adorable. Others, I suppose, might not. We will be back in Istabul in January on our way back to New York after a protracted trip. Despite my general great preference for anything I have not previously experienced to anything I have, we have already booked for the Angel' Home.

Reviews.Title: “not so great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: as you arrive at the hotel you are greeted by many cats occupying all seats at the small lobby. dogs are also part of the scene. they will be guests at your bed if you leave the window open. the hotel comprises of two adjucent buildings. the good and the bad. make sure you don't end up in the latter. hotel simple and clean. decoration its a matter of taste, very dark brown furniture and dark red bed linen cover. pretty oppresive. the view from the window is directly onto a carpet shop. the bathroom is clean but very small and unless very slim its very difficult to negotiate into the bath due to the shower screen. to reach breakfast on the terrace with a view you need to climb 6 flights of stairs then decent down an iron flight of stairs (doesnt feel safe) to where breakfast is served. you need to be really fit to to reach the top. the stairs are quite deep so its not very comfortable even if you raise to the challenge when you go downstairs its always in the dark. the lights is trrigerred by sensors which obviousely failed to operate effectively. so breakfast is pretty much a risky business. staff don't speak english only the owners. its a family run hotel so you share breakfast internet cats and everything else with the rest of the family who dont interact with guests. this makes one feels quite uncomfortable. the new owners are polite, distant and not particularly friendly. if you book through an agency you may end up in a room not suitable even for a cat. do not accept. do not agree to pay for an upgrade just walk out. there are many better hotels which offer much better value for much less money. i have moved to a different hotel and this made all the difference to the way i experienced istanbul. what a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: esurman
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Istanbul and enjoyed my three nights at Angel's Home. The staff provides excellent service and its a nice little place. Sultanhamet is a bit noisy in places and this hotel is on a quiet street. The other postings are correct, a great choice in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel deserves the hype - Jerry and Bobbi from New York”
Reviews.Author: cardplay
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Angel's Home at the end of May through beginning of June of 2006. We were concerned a little because of all the hype on trip advisor, but decided to chance it anyway. The hotel lived up to the hype. We were very pleased with the accommodations, and with the attentiveness of the staff. The brothers Hakan and Okan were more than just nice people, they were good people, who take pride in their hotel and are truely concerned with what people think of their hotel. Some of the large hotel chains could certainly learn something about the hotel business from them. Istanbul itself was wonderful, but what needs to be stated in guide books is just how hilly the city is. If you are middle-aged like my wife and I, before you go, you need to spend a month walking and getting into shape, or you may find yourself extemely tired with leg cramps. There is a street with many restaurants whose food was very good just a few blocks from the hotel. When you leave the hotel, turn left, go to the corner, then turn left and go one block. Turn right and one block down you will find the restaurants. This was our first trip to Istanbul, and we can highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A genuine taste of Turkey”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were pleased to find our hotel was on a little, winding, cobbled street with a genuine flavour of another culture. Just behind the hustle and bustle of the old town it offered a peaceful refuge. We were warmly welcomed by the incredibly friendly and very helpful staff and appreciated the individual decor which spelt out home rather than hotel to us. We enjoyed a simple meal of mezzes, eggplant and fish served on the rooftop restaurant on our first night. The access to the sights of the old town was brilliant and we wandered back and forth most days. Lots of the famous sights such as the mosques and bazaars are just a short stroll from the hotel. On two nights of our four night stays we caught taxis to other districts to dine at restaurants. We were very happy at Angels Home Hotel and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tirtha
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in the middle of the ancient Istanbul I think this is the right place, and don't miss the terrace on the top, it is breathtaking, we really enjoyed breakfast and some dinner watching the sea by one side and the blue mosque (and Haghia Sophia too) by the other, listening the beautiful chants of the prayers coming from the mosques all around. And what about the hotel? Well, it is a small and clean hotel, with young and nice staff, nice cats, and very comfortable rooms with safe and all the gadgets. The only bad note is that from our room during the night time we heard every kind of voice and noise coming from inside the hotel, even each step on the stairs... But luckyness the hotel is located in a quiet area!!! This is a problem of good education of other guests but maybe the owners could do something to insulate the rooms... Maybe I expected more inside, as another guest said I'm not sure the decor of the hotel (rooms hall and stairs too) is the right one, there are statues and other decorative plaques in many different styles (egyptian, italian renaissance, others...) but in turkish style I did'nt find, it's a shame because we are talking about a traditional (and historical) turkish building. Anyway if you like to stay in a hotel with a young and fresh style and you are planning to spend few nights in Istanbul I suggest you to spend your holiday in this hotel, even if you take your children with you, my son enjoyed the cats, the terrace with big cushions and the nice babysitter Mina (the daughter of one of the Duyar brothers) too (he spent only one hour with her but enough to fall in love with her...). For sure we'll suggest this hotel to all our friends! Matteo Tiziana & Francesco Raffaelli (Italy)

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our honeymoon in Istanbul, where we stayed 5 nights at the Angel's hotel. We got the Deluxe room so I do not know how the standard rooms are. Ours was quite big and with a very nice bathroom. The staff are very friendly and the breakfast is just average, we missed some fruit and maybe a larger selection of cooked food. It is nice having breakfast outside although due to windy weather conditions, he had to stay inside half the time. There are a few cats (2 kittens and three adults at least) playing around in and out the reception so I hope you like them and have no allergies :) They are also very friendly and my wife loved playing with the kittens every day on our way to the breakfast room. You also get free access to the gym and free internet connection. The location is quite good, less than 5 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and the Sophia, which you will see illuminated every day on your way back to the hotel. In 5 days we only took the tram once, as from the hotel you can go to all main attractions if you do not mind walking a bit. Nothing exceptional but good value for a mid range hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: victoriasw7
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a deluxe double room for 4 nights in April. The hotel is in a fantastic location to the major sights but poorly positioned for Istanbul's fine dining and nightlife. We had dinner one evening locally (the restaurant down the steps which was referred to in another review, Balikci Sabahattin, --we had a very good experience there in terms of food and service) but spent the other nights taking taxis to restaurants in the Beyoglu and Taksim. Be warned: the traffic in Istanbul is HORRIBLE. Taxis would take 20+ minutes to go about 2 miles to the bridge over the Bosphorus. For this reason alone, we wish we had stayed in another area. Back to the hotel, it is an older building with accompanying smells and mustiness. The decor is seriously out of date--if my Grandmother ran a bordello I imagine it would look like this. The breakfast rooftop dining offers great views but the food leaves much to be desired. We ate up there twice and then opted to eat out the other days. Angel's Home was a good value, but if we were returning to Istanbul we'd definitely stay elsewhere. Highly recommend the Cagaloglu baths (not for the modest but a once in a lifetime experience), Hamdi et Lokantasi for lunch (near the Spice Bazaar), and the rooftop of the Seven HIlls hotel for post-sightseeing drinks (across from the Four Seasons).

Reviews.Title: “Definitely coming back to this treasure of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to be invited to a Turkish wedding(what an experience!) and took our chances booking the Angel's Home hotel never having visited Turkey before. We could not fault the hotel. The staff were all friendly and very helpful. The rooms were equipped to a very good standard with every care taken to ensure all home comforts were provided...from the tea and coffee making facilities,minibar,safe,to the sewing kit, cotton buds, shoeshine,slippers and fluffy dressing gowns...to name a few!!! The breakfast was buffet style with a lovely choice and on the beautiful sunny days we enjoyed eating out on the roof terrace with views over the Blue Mosque and surrounds. It would be very tempting to try and keep this hotel a secret so it does not get too popular in case we can't book in next time we visit and we definitely would want to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Magical City, Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeanthelibraryqueen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from several days in Istanbul, a marvellous city. The trip (which would have been very good anyway) was made really special by staying at this charming hotel. We booked a superior double room (Room 217), which was at the front of the hotel, with a large double bed and a single bed. The room was spotless, and the ensuite bathroom was excellent - the bathrobes, slippers and collection of toiletries rivalled much more expensive places. The staff are friendly and attentive, and the owners are utterly marvellous people. Friendly and helpful, they were happy to advise us how to explore Istanbul on our own, making suggestions to improve our forays. The trips they do offer (no hard sell at all) are good value, as they refuse the commission trip organisers pay to hotels , and insist that the saving is passed on to their guests. Yes, really! The rates are a real bargain. The hotel offers a simple evening meal which is very reasonable, and snacks at lunchtime, if you don't want to explore the neighbouring restaurants every evening. We also ate at the fish restaurant recommended by the owners, and it was reasonably priced, friendly, with live music. We even got a lift there in the cool Chevy Bel Air! On our final day I was keen to buy a couple of bags at the local Cavalry Bazaar - the previous day I had tried to bargain but had failed miserably. When I mentioned my plight, one of the owners contacted a friend of his at a local shop, who went with me to the bazaar and succeeded admirably where I had failed. How's that for service above and beyond the call of duty? We enjoyed talking to them about life, the universe and everything over a glass of tea, and wish we were still there. A great holiday experience! Everywhere we went in Istanbul we were welcomed, and given help with directions and anything else we needed. The shopkeepers in general do try and lure you into their shops, but a polite "no thanks", delivered with a smile, is enough. Not like our experiences in parts of Egypt and India! Mind you, there are some lovely carpets I mught just have to go back for ...

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Angels Home Hotel is a superb little hotel, great value for money and in the best location, within walking distance of all the sights in the Sultanahmet Area, virtually next door to the Blue Mosque. It is safe to walk around this area even in the evening, which, as I was travelling alone with my 9 year old daugher was really important to me. Its ony a short walk to the tram which we found was a great way to get around Istanbul when you're legs get tired! The rooms there are lovely, decent size and really airy. Our room was spotless with more than adequate provisions, free bathroom bits, hairdryer (very important to us girls!), tea and coffee, sensibly priced minibar, tv with lots of international channels etc. The staff were fantastic, really friendly and full of loads of useful tips for making the most of our break. We will definatley return to this hotel next time in Istanbul and highly recommend it to any other first time visitor to Isanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Try somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If friendliness is what you are looking for, this is the place. Everything else...you can probably do better. We stayed in the suite on the top floor. A nice sized room, but run down. Fixtures aren't attached properly; bathroom fittings leak. Biggest problem were hords of ants that came up through a gap in the carpet everytime you walked across the room. Food is mediocre at best. Hakan and Okan are really friendly and went out of their way to help, but given that we were paying top rates for a small Istanbul hotel I was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & hospitality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a five day trip to Istanbul. This lovely, quirky little hotel (which we found through tripadvisor.com) is bang in the middle of the old quarter, just a stone's throw away from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia and has a number of pleasant restaurants nearby. (Although the guide book reviewers tend to turn their noses up at retaurants in this area we liked being able to walk back to our hotel after dinner and not have to either negotiate public transport (which is confusing enough when you're sober), or get a taxi (which inevitably means getting lost). Our room was spacious, spotlessly clean and had all mod cons such as tea/coffee making facilities and a mini-bar. We were very relieved to find that the plumbing was as in the UK (ie no bin by the loo!). All of the staff were charming, helpful and spoke good English. If we ever return to Istanbul we will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disappointed given that this is top in Istanbul on this site”
Reviews.Author: londonscot
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from two nights at Angel's Home. The location is indeed fantastic - very close to the Blue Mosque and with breathtaking rooftop views of it and the Bosphorus. However, there are many hotels in the immediate area that can most likely offer the same. The rooms are adequate size and decorated in, shall we say, boudoir style, with heart-shaped cushions, red ribbons round the towels, that sort of thing. The staff were very friendly and made you feel very welcome. This was definitely in the cosy idiosyncratic small hotel bracket rather than functional business-type. The breakfast was nothing to write home about but was OK. Didn't try the evening meal service, but made use of the rooftop bar (the small enclosed section - it was too cold at this time of year to go outside once it got dark).

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in a great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Angel's Home for a week at the end of February 2006. The hotel was more than we expected, it was warm, very clean and above all friendly. We took our 7 year old daughter, who loved the kittens and although they were kept behind the reception desk, we were never made to feel unwelcome when looking at them. Hakan and Okan (owners) were extrmely helpful giving advice on where to shop, eat and visit and how to get there. They assisted us in arranging an excusion and visit to a wonderful fish restaurant. One little niggle is that there could be more storage space in the rooms, but other than that it was fabulous. Very close to the hotel is a street where there are a number of great restaurant / cafes / bars, we particularly liked the Albura and the Turquoise.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: johngreenink
Reviews.Content: For my first trip to Istanbul, Angel's Home was a wise choice for a hotel. Aside from very comfortable rooms, and a superb location (less than five minutes away from the Aya Sophia and the Blue Mosque) it is equally close to the Sultanahmet transit stop, and the buses that can take you to Eminonu for ferries, or across the bridges to Beyoglu (the European city.) The hotel's staff is extrememly knowledgeable about how to find places, where to look for certain specialty shops, and many other important details for getting around the city. The staff is also ready to assist at any time of day or night, including wake up calls, arranging for tours or airport rides, and serving an exceptionally good breakfast in the mornings at the rooftop restaurant. In addition, the rooms contain very cozy bedding and ammenities, which are exceptionally clean, with excellent housekeeping. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Istanbul - especially to those who are making a first trip and need assistace moving around the city. The owners/managers are ready to help in any situation, which can be very important when one is in a new city. In addition to all these reasons to stay, it is a very affordable hotel - an unquestionable value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the hype”
Reviews.Author: Rallukhotelsdire
Reviews.Content: I booked what I thought would be a special weekend break for my husband & me. We booked the top floor suite which has the huge misfortune of being right underneath breakfast. Footsteps up, down stairs, and overhead took away any thoughts of passion and romance. Our balcony seemed to be the staff smoking corner too -- so despite the fact we'd booked the room what seems to be a high season cost, other people were in and out when we weren't there -- neglecting to dispose of their cigarette butts and ashes. Next time we'll out for less "charm" and more value for money.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Turkish Hospitality in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: LeftyFBS
Reviews.Content: Another business trip to wonderful Istanbul and I was forced to stay yet again in the five star (so-called) Conrad. Besides the fine view from the 14th floor, I was more than happy to extend my visit to Istanbul after the meeting. This meant checking out of the awful, dire, unhelpful Conrad, and checking in to the wonderful ambience of the Angel's Hame hotel in Sultanahmet. The room was a true bargain for eur 49/59. It was clean, tidy, and when I asked about a potential problem with the phone, one of the family came up immediately to have a look. Every request made was executed promptly by the brothers and their family. By far the best service I have ever come across in Istanbul. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have stayed longer....”
Reviews.Author: southweststeak
Reviews.Content: Really darling boutique hotel. Loved the valentine/ Angel's theme throughout-Red is one of my favorite colors. Staff was very accomodating and helpful-had to leave in the wee hours of the morning and the clerks presented me with a box of Turkish sweets when I left! I would go back and take advantage of the many deals offered, e.g. terrace restaurant dinner for the first meal in Istanbul (with a stunning view-missed it), whirling dervishes (Wed.) was fantastic, belly dancing (Thurs.) was actually seen at the Music Hall (better according to locals?), Calgiglou hamam-oldest and best in Istanbul was within walking distance (women, be prepared for community of naked women bathing), breakfast was hot and delicious; overall a safe and clean place for a 2 night stay. (Istanbul was a stopover during my Greece vacation.) Recommendations: Plan ahead and to stay about a week at least-many local events/palaces are only open on certain days during the winter, MWF, or once a week, etc. I arrived Wed. and was able to see everything I wanted in 2 days but I had to take the Havash bus directly from the airport to Taksim and then taxi to Dolmabache palace as they were open only wed and then Saturday. Women should wear wedding bands, fake, etc. Turkish men are very hospitable, always offereing apple tea, but be firm and say no esp. if you have just arrived in the city and are steered towards a carpet vendor's store! The university-educated Turkish men are more touchy-feely, similar to their European counterparts? Be firm and tell them to stop touching/massaging you or you will leave. Also they may quote carpet prices as labor & cost for one month of work ($230); Be sure and get the total cost for a carpet. Expect to pay between $1200 to $4000 for a large quality silk or wool carpet. I bought a small silk one for less than $900, but everyone says I got a deal. Also, be general about questions from where you are from-I told one Turkish vendor I was from California, San Franciso, but born in Korea and every Turkish man on the block knew and would refer to me as such. Hotel perks included free internet, hot water, fluffy robe and signature slippers, and breakfast with local breads (Simit!). Feral but tame cats live everywhere (Greece too) but I had no problems (allergic). Used local hospitality to learn tons about Istanbul/Turkish culture-even smoked a hooka pipe (ask how apple tobacco is made)without incidents. I travelled by myself. Have a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Not value for money at all”
Reviews.Author: AusTravellerKG
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed At Angels Home for our wedding anniversary and we were very disappoitned with our room (the Angel Suite). Amongst other things, the shower flooded and whist we arranged for the hotel to pick us up from the airport - there was no one there, nor did they call us to let us know that they could not make it (even though I had given them my mobile). The only real panoramic view can be had from the balcony on the very top floor and there is no elevator - so there are a lot of stairs to cover before breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “trying, but not there yet”
Reviews.Author: moeski
Reviews.Content: Despite many emails re: our arrival date and need for airport pickup there was no transportation that we could see at the Istanbul airport. This necessitated our taking a more expensive shuttle to the hotel at 10 o'clock at night. When we arrived we were told there was no room available for us, despite having booked well in advance, months actually with confirmation. We were put up around the corner in an acceptable hotel. Next day one of the brothers told us that actually they did have an empty room as someone from the tour did not show up!!!! ( We obviously had been bumped by a tour group). Needless to say we were not impressed. We were given a large room the next day. We were charged only the same for our transport from the airport as the hotel would have charged. The staff were very nice and accomodating. The views excellent, as well as the location. However, they still have a long way to go in provision of service, but are trying hard.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great City”
Reviews.Author: Patstravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 3 hotels in the area of the Blue Mosque and this was definately the nicest, with the biggest room. Rooms in the smaller hotels tend to be compact but Angels was wonderful, large bathroom, helpful staff and a very nice breakfast. Great location, we walked everywhere. We were not pleased with the tour from the brochure in the hotel, but that was seperate from the hotel and we learned to buy a book and do the tours on our own. Only negative was that the shower had a large lip to get in (about 2 feet hight and 1 feet deep) so it would be difficult for someone older to get in and out. I don't know if that was only our room, but it says wheelchair accessable so I would ask when booking if one was the least bit worried about falling. The view from the rooftop where breakfast is served was wonderful. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Oasis in Old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a quiet place in the the old part of Istanbul, the "Angels Home" is the right choice. The stuff is very friendly but not unobstrusively. The rooms are clean and nice furnished. All services the hotel offers like airport-transfer, sightseeing and others are available with really fair prices. The good breakfast is served on the roof of the hotel with a phantastic view to many highlights of the marvelously Istanbul. We can recommend the "Angels Home" without any doubt. Det & Doris, Germany

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: postoumios
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in this beautiful hotel for 8 days this Sept.We got a spacious deluxe double room (that actually had a huge king size double bed AND a single bed). Breakfast was very good & the hotel was very conveniently located. The greatest asset of this hotel though is the two brothers/owners who were some of the best hotelkeepers I've ever seen,extremely polite,helpfull & caring. We will definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Mixed on Hotel”
Reviews.Author: heymuchacho
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in early September. The hotel staff were all excellent. Very helpful. However, we found our room a bit to be desired. Though bigger than most rooms, it just was not that well maintained. The air conditioner leaked, and the view outside our room (ground floor) was of an abandoned yard (trash, etc.). The location is okay, but a little bit on the edge of the historic area. Breakfast on the roof top was nice. Dinner was inexpensive, though the hotel is not set up for restaurant quality food. I don't recommend the suggested Bosporous Boat Cruise by the way. We stayed at the Seven Hills earlier on our trip. I would recommend it over Angels Home. Nice room, clean, great staff, the best roof top view in the area.
